commit_message:
Check if namespace exists before getting devices

If a neutron router has no ports defined, its namespace is deleted
by the cronjob /etc/cron.d/neutron-l3-agent-netns-cleanup.
It is required to check if the namespace exists before calling
iproute2 commands against the namespace.
It is not enough for the string of the namespace uuid to be defined,
the namespace must really exist on the network node.
This patch checks if the namespace exists when calling get_devices().
Otherwise the agent log file will be flooded with messages like
Cannot open network namespace "qrouter-<uuid>": No such file or directory
Failed to process compatible router '<uuid>'

Related-bug: 1573073

Change-Id: I744ef11529f9da5cbfdb812de0b35b95f9d078bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/50/309050/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixup the start of swift services

Seems the conditional has changed and we should pickup the
tripleo::profile::base::swift::storage::enable_swift_storage
hiera data.

After controller nodes are upgraded the swift services were down
even though there was no stand-alone swift node (the current
conditional was failing as that hiera isn't set any more)

Closes-Bug: 1638821
Change-Id: Id1383c1e54f9cae13fd375e90da525230e5d23eb
(cherry picked from commit a7af5b90e4fa432973a7ab2f27df5427387b01c0)

commit_message:
Remove the old rabbitmq queues

The upgrade process doesn't remove the existing queues with the old
hostnames (with _). To remove the queues, we need to create a user
with admin rights for every vhosts (the existing users per service
 can't delete queues), and then use the API to delete the queues.

The API is not really user friendly, so we are using a python script
instead. This script is delivered with the management plugin of
rabbitmq, so we just have to fetch it and use it.

Finally, the temporary user is deleted, and its password is
cleaned up.

The removal of the queues will also remove them from the bindings.

Change-Id: Ic67d96fb3dc0ada7bff4d6597ca76977f5228f77
Closes-Bug: #1632098

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-27 23:25:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/080_update_quota_resource_length.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_migrations.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d8e7741f9ac74afd08d2f329ae00faf9d69b946e', 'message': "Fix for resource field length in database for quota tables

Problem description:
Currently whenever the combination of (volume_type,property) is longer
255 characters for resource column in quota tables, the cinder
quota-update command errors. This change increases the length to 275
so that even if the length of volume_type is 256 characters, the
resource column gets some extra space and command does not error out

Challenge:
During live upgrade, then operator is supposed to migrate the DB first.
Now the problem is that in MySQL expanding VARCHAR table field
from <0;255> length to <256;+inf). It is an operation that will copy
whole table and lock it for writing during the migration.
This isn't something you want to do on a live deployment. Hence,
there can be a impact during upgrade for the same

Closes-bug: #1608849

UpgradeImpact

commit_message:
Fix for resource field length in database for quota tables

Problem description:
Currently whenever the combination of (volume_type,property) is longer
255 characters for resource column in quota tables, the cinder
quota-update command errors. This change increases the length to 275
so that even if the length of volume_type is 256 characters, the
resource column gets some extra space and command does not error out

Challenge:
During live upgrade, then operator is supposed to migrate the DB first.
Now the problem is that in MySQL expanding VARCHAR table field
from <0;255> length to <256;+inf). It is an operation that will copy
whole table and lock it for writing during the migration.
This isn't something you want to do on a live deployment. Hence,
there can be a impact during upgrade for the same

Closes-bug: #1608849

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I9da21132814b11caf601038d04e28b49bd029701
(cherry picked from commit e07ad41f8e3ff3b424262b3eb8a71afdd158592b)

commit_message:
Ignore case when comparing wwns in Pure FC driver

We would previously just assume the wwpns in our connector were lower-case
and this was not valid for all systems. We will now compare with all
lower case strings.

Change-Id: Icdb818c97fc7810b5276b83debf8e75fe48fd15d
Closes-Bug: #1612866
(cherry picked from commit b5214838303e56d0556a843ee40da591cd747b87)

commit_message:
Add port to rabbitmq node ip list

We use the rabbit_hosts configuration for most of our services but we
haven't been adding the configured port. This patch appends the IP port
used provided to the service's heat template to the IPs in the list.

Note: while we could use the value set for the rabbitmq server in
rabbitmq::port, it doesn't allow for dealing with SSL. This also is also
backwards compatible with the RabbitClientPort parameters used in the
heat templates.

Change-Id: I0000f039144a6b0e98c0a148dc69324f60db3d8b
Closes-Bug: #1633580
(cherry picked from commit 597194a4199b34e1389b26f080ae1fefccbca924)

commit_message:
3par driver handles concurrent host create conflict

One of the step in creating a FC VLUN is to create a host on array.
When there happens to have simultaneous request for creating same host,
hpe3parclient will create host for one and return HTTP 409 conflict for others,
with error code 73, message "host WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host".
This was not handled by 3PAR driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to
volume manager where it would log it. This patch addresses this bug by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Closes-Bug: #1597454

(Cherry picked from commit 3c18a2e41ace1144fd53a1223f612e8a15d0b9ff)
Additionally revised naming HPE to HP

Change-Id: I66e4f80696c782ab869ef0d7848fc6f3b3100c04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/25/351925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: class HTTPConflict(Exception): if error and 'message' in error: self._error_desc = error['message']

commit_message:
Add object-reconstructor for swift EC

Swift Erasure Coding requires the object-reconstructor to be running,
this PR adds the object-reconstructor configuration and systemd/upstart
file.

Additionally, this PR adds testing for an erasure-coding policy as well
as for multiple policies in 1 deployment.

Change-Id: I71fe3d77e93112b9d27c93b37b59e6242cb3e00e
Closes-Bug: #1634859
(cherry picked from commit cd222e8cff2dafe6f6ae5d67f95b5ed35e246e41)

commit_message:
Remove ansible<2.2 apt cache hack

Now ansible apt module correctly behaves, so it's time
to deprecate these cruft tasks for apt.

Change-Id: Ia05ef41b5606c6a219eeb66cdeb56fdcaeccbffb

commit_message:
Update openstack-puppet-modules dependencies

OPM package is metadata package with unversioned requirements which
means that update does not update the dependencies. This leaves us
with old puppet modules and old puppet during the puppet run.

Change-Id: I80f8a73142a09bb4178bb5a396d256ba81ba98a8
Closes-Bug: #1638266
Resolves: rhbz#1390559
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/23/392123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Upgrading openstack-puppet-modules and its dependencies" yum deplist openstack-puppet-modules | awk '/dependency/{print $2}' | xargs yum -q -y update

commit_message:
Use correct password for keystone bootstrap

In upstream puppet-keystone, the boostrap process should use an admin
password not the admin token for the bootstrapping of keystone. The
admin password option is being added to the upstream class so we will
need to provide it to properly have keystone bootstrapped.

Change-Id: Icab4b0cb70d6caf2f2792c4fe730f060b807fbc1
Depends-On: I7a706d93b43ec025bdb4b29667f64ff2f7dd52a0
Related-Bug: #1621959
(cherry picked from commit 333f6b322765100f2d2fb9d9f4b8426a9a8dde45)

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I2b3aff99b8ee1c8870f89598cf7cf0a2165af3b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/62/392662/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: neutron_developer_mode | bool extra_args: >- {{ (pip_install_upper_constraints is defined) | ternary('--constraint ' + pip_install_upper_constraints | default(''),'') }} {{ pip_install_options | default('') }} extra_args: >- {{ keystone_developer_mode | ternary('--constraint /opt/developer-pip-constraints.txt', '') }} {{ (pip_install_upper_constraints is defined) | ternary('--constraint ' + pip_install_upper_constraints | default(''),'') }} {{ pip_install_options | default('') }}
deleted_lines: when: - neutron_developer_mode | bool - name: Clone requirements git repository git: repo: "{{ neutron_requirements_git_repo }}" dest: "/opt/requirements" clone: yes update: yes version: "{{ neutron_requirements_git_install_branch }}" when: - neutron_developer_mode | bool - name: Add constraints to pip_install_options fact for developer mode set_fact: pip_install_options_fact: "{{ pip_install_options|default('') }} --constraint /opt/developer-pip-constraints.txt --constraint /opt/requirements/upper-constraints.txt" when: - neutron_developer_mode | bool - name: Set pip_install_options_fact when not in developer mode set_fact: pip_install_options_fact: "{{ pip_install_options|default('') }}" when: - not neutron_developer_mode | bool extra_args: "{{ pip_install_options_fact }}" extra_args: "{{ pip_install_options_fact }}"

commit_message:
Temporarily pin Tempest SHA for Sahara testing

As of October 5 with https://review.openstack.org/380082 the
tempest tests for data_processing are no longer included in
tempest.

This patch pins the tempest SHA used to the parent of that
patch to allow functional testing to continue until a revision
of the functional testing in this role can be done.

Change-Id: Ia5dcca5cd36da3af26d4ad608fbf6b311433f942
Related-Bug: 1638883

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Iaf085a3f58dde94c3f02a0a6e5161e9e07766db4
(cherry picked from commit 244a8301853e439b88e243bc6307caf05096d14d)

commit_message:
Move old oslo-incubator code out of openstack/common

As part of the first community-wide goal, teams were asked to
remove the openstack/common package of their projects if one
existed. This was a byproduct of the old oslo-incubator form
of syncing common functionality.

The package, apiclient, was moved to a top level location and
cliutils was moved to the common module. There are no oslo
specific libraries, the recommended solution is to move it in
tree and maintain it there.

Change-Id: Iee52004bd33c19d63133577ff466164b85fd6ca6

commit_message:
Make method import_versioned_module work

Update function import_versioned_module in Oslo.utils 3.17.
This patch update to meet new version. For more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/history.html

Change-Id: Ia031b53b27fcea66dbf4f2798d58b51c53c2d0cc
Closes-Bug: #1627313

commit_message:
move Ocata final release to 22 Feb 2017

Based on feedback during the fishbowl session held at the Ocata summit
in Barcelona, downstream consumers of the final release would like the
release to happen earlier in the week to give them time to create
packages before the weekend. This change moves the final release date
forward one day from Thursday 23 Feb to Wednesday 22 Feb to accommodate
this request. Impact on project teams is expected to be minimal, because
the release team creates the final tag based on existing release
candidates.

Change-Id: I91834e6b89827f928588932d3ea74f938f5d32a4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Install ceilometer-polling on compute nodes

With the move to using a service-group mapping for installing services,
the ceilometer-polling agent now only installs on hosts within the
ceilometer_central_agent group when it should also be installed to the
ceilometer_compute_agent group. Adjust the service mapping to allow for
multiple group assignments per service and update relevant tasks to use
subelements to install each service within its assigned groups.

Also fix the 'Reload upstart init scripts' handler so that it can
properly be marked 'changed' in order to notify the 'Restart
ceilometer services' handler.

Closes-Bug: 1639026
Change-Id: Iba8e1f58c996a55389f50c727a4afa55099daa22

commit_message:
Fix bind mount of glance images

Bind mount should be created when glance_nfs_client is
either undefined OR empty

Change-Id: I59b183dc376fd64300d088c9831fe5ea2e7412f0
Closes-Bug: #1638907

commit_message:
Remove ansible<2.2 apt cache hack

Now ansible apt module correctly behaves, so it's time
to deprecate these cruft tasks for apt.

Change-Id: I665b0919d796088ca62267b96d2ba8d5fe582675
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate refs/changes/13/393513/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #TODO(evrardjp): Replace the next 2 tasks by a standard apt with cache #when https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/pull/1517 is merged #in 1.9.x or we move to 2.0 (if tested working) - name: Check apt last update file stat: path: /var/cache/apt register: apt_cache_stat - name: Update apt if needed apt: update_cache: yes when: "ansible_date_time.epoch|float - apt_cache_stat.stat.mtime > {{cache_timeout}}"

commit_message:
Fix Release Notes index page title

This commit fixes the index page title of release notes from "Unreleased
Release Notes" to "Current Series Release Notes". (It's same as
subunit2sql.) Because the page has also "released release notes".

Change-Id: I55efda89d96829bb306d810aa308a99eab72d8f6

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/38/393338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `createflashcache SIZE`, where size must be in 16 GB increments. For example, `createflashcache 128g` will create 128 GB of Flash the volume `migrate`, `retype` and `manage` volume snapshots. This applies to the volume `snapshot-*`LDAP and AD authentication is now supported in the HPE 3PAR driver. The 3PAR backend must be properly configured for LDAP/AD authentication prior to configuring the Cinder driver. Details on setting up LDAP with 3PAR can be found in the 3PAR user guide. Once configured, `hpe3par_username` and `hpe3par_password` parameters in ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` can be used with LDAP/AD credentials. To stop the Web Services API Server, use the `stopwsapi` command. For other options run the `setwsapi –h` command.
deleted_lines: :command:`createflashcache SIZE`, where size must be in 16 GB increments. For example, :command:`createflashcache 128g` will create 128 GB of Flash the volume :command:`migrate`, :command:`retype` and :command:`manage` volume snapshots. This applies to the volume :command:`snapshot-*`LDAP authentication is supported if the 3PAR is configured to do so. To stop the Web Services API Server, use the :command:`stopwsapi` command. For other options run the :command:`setwsapi –h` command.

commit_message:
Remove last vestiges of oslo-incubator

This is a community goal for Ocata.  We're already not using any of
the code, but there are some other files and references left over.

These files used to be installed from oslo-incubator:
  tools/install_venv.py
  tools/install_venv_common.py
  tools/with_venv.sh
They were meant to be used by the legacy run_tests.sh, which does not
exist in this repo.

Change-Id: I5523427aa3835cd732ec973dd2e821cac9363a12
Partial-Bug: #1639103
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/61/393561/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Copyright 2010 OpenStack Foundation. # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Installation script for Neutron's development virtualenv """ from __future__ import print_function import os import sys import install_venv_common as install_venv def print_help(): help = """ Neutron development environment setup is complete. Neutron development uses virtualenv to track and manage Python dependencies while in development and testing. To activate the Neutron virtualenv for the extent of your current shell session you can run: $ source .venv/bin/activate Or, if you prefer, you can run commands in the virtualenv on a case by case basis by running: $ tools/with_venv.sh <your command> Also, make test will automatically use the virtualenv. """ print(help) def main(argv): root = os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__))) venv = os.path.join(root, '.venv') pip_requires = os.path.join(root, 'requirements.txt') test_requires = os.path.join(root, 'test-requirements.txt') py_version = "python%s.%s" % (sys.version_info[0], sys.version_info[1]) project = 'Neutron' install = install_venv.InstallVenv(root, venv, pip_requires, test_requires, py_version, project) options = install.parse_args(argv) install.check_python_version() install.check_dependencies() install.create_virtualenv(no_site_packages=options.no_site_packages) install.install_dependencies() print_help() if __name__ == '__main__': main(sys.argv)

commit_message:
Improve playbook to setup gate nodes

* use become instead of sudo
* use file instead of shell to change file modes
* rename setup_nodes.yml to playbook-setup-nodes.yml

Fault injection hook plugin

This patch adds os-faults to requirements.txt and allows to
use this library as hook plugin.

commit_message:
Using new style assertions instead of  old style assertions

Replace 'assertTrue(a in b)' with 'assertIn(a, b)'.
Replace 'assertTrue(a not in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'.
Replace 'assertFalse(a in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'.

Change-Id: Ifcb490481ed58b0223029cc257b22a53ad0e5a42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/50/393650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIn("no such function", str(matched)) self.assertIn("no such function", str(matched))
deleted_lines: self.assertTrue("no such function" in str(matched)) self.assertTrue("no such function" in str(matched))

commit_message:
Use ConfigParser instead of SafeConfigParser in Python 3

The SafeConfigParser class has been renamed to ConfigParser in
Python 3.2 [1]. The alias SafeConfigParser maybe removed in
future versions of Python 3. Use ConfigParser instead of
SafeConfigParser in Python 3
[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue10627

Change-Id: I1354b9fde203c9478bd77b71ec74a69304428385
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/57/375257/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six # SafeConfigParser was deprecated in Python 3.2 if six.PY3: config = configparser.ConfigParser() else: config = configparser.SafeConfigParser()

commit_message:
Fixup the start of swift services

Seems the conditional has changed and we should pickup the
tripleo::profile::base::swift::storage::enable_swift_storage
hiera data.

After controller nodes are upgraded the swift services were down
even though there was no stand-alone swift node (the current
conditional was failing as that hiera isn't set any more)

Closes-Bug: 1638821
Change-Id: Id1383c1e54f9cae13fd375e90da525230e5d23eb

commit_message:
Add replacepkgs to the manual ovs upgrade workaround and fix a typo

rpm command will return an exit 1 if ovs package is already
there and will exit the step_1.sh script. To get around this
force the update with --replacepkgs

Also remove the \ just before the $ which cause a syntax
error for the ceph storage

Change-Id: I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9
Closes-bug: 1636748
(cherry picked from commit 61cba946cd11ab3a2d6518663f2300d7c98083de)
Conflicts:
	extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh

added_lines: echo "Updating openvswitch with nopostun option" rpm -U --replacepkgs --nopostun ./*.rpm

commit_message:
Add special case handling for OVS upgrade in updates and upgrades

This adds a special case handling for the opensvswitch package
as discussed at the related bug below.
This is added/handled here for both the minor update and the
major mitaka...newton upgrade.

Change-Id: I9b1f0eaa0d36a28e20b507bec6a4e9b3af1781ae
Closes-Bug: 1635205
(cherry picked from commit 25268151502b90aa1648578fbf7dedae377221a2)
Conflicts:
	extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh
	extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/88/393688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Special-case OVS for https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1635205 if [[ -n \$(rpm -q --scripts openvswitch | awk '/postuninstall/,/*/' | grep "systemctl.*try-restart") ]]; then echo "Manual upgrade of openvswitch - restart in postun detected" mkdir OVS_UPGRADE || true pushd OVS_UPGRADE echo "Attempting to downloading latest openvswitch with yumdownloader" yumdownloader --resolve openvswitch echo "Updating openvswitch with nopostun" rpm -U --nopostun ./*.rpm popd else echo "Skipping manual upgrade of openvswitch - no restart in postun detected" fi

commit_message:
Allow building heat-agents image from master

Previously, the heat-agents image didn't build unless we exported the
OPENSTACK_RELEASE environment variable at build time. This commit
remove that limitation and build the image using RDO master when the
environment variable is not set.

Change-Id: I3a693b978c2ffd00a438fc9e1ff8a9353df8f50b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/66/384866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "$OPENSTACK_RELEASE" ]; then # Install specified OpenStack release yum -y install http://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-$OPENSTACK_RELEASE/rdo-release-$OPENSTACK_RELEASE.rpm else # Install from master curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo \ http://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/rdo-trunk-master-tripleo/delorean.repo curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo \ http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current/delorean.repo sed -i 's/\[delorean\]/\[delorean-current\]/' /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo cat << EOF >> /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo includepkgs=diskimage-builder,instack,instack-undercloud,os-apply-config,os-cloud-config,os-collect-config,os-net-config,os-refresh-config,python-tripleoclient,tripleo-common,openstack-tripleo-heat-templates,openstack-tripleo-image-elements,openstack-tripleo,openstack-tripleo-puppet-elements,openstack-puppet-modules EOF curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo \ http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/delorean-deps.repo yum -y install yum-plugin-priorities
deleted_lines: if [ -z "$OPENSTACK_RELEASE" ]; then echo "Please, set OPENSTACK_RELEASE to the desired openstack version." echo "You can run the build command as: " echo "OPENSTACK_RELEASE=newton docker build -t tripleoupstream/heat-docker-agents:\$OPENSTACK_RELEASE --build-arg OPENSTACK_RELEASE=\$OPENSTACK_RELEASE ." exit 1yum -y install http://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-$OPENSTACK_RELEASE/rdo-release-$OPENSTACK_RELEASE.rpm

commit_message:
Clean up configure_containers.sh script

Remove packages that are apparently not being used in heat-agents
container and depend on python-heat-agent-puppet rather than a list of
individual packages.

Make it clear which packages are runtime dependencies and which are
only required for their configuration files. Packages are now sorted
alphabetically.

Change-Id: Ice602c89deb2a821d0d3fb9b78f5d045af3d287b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/65/384865/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "OPENSTACK_RELEASE=newton docker build -t tripleoupstream/heat-docker-agents:\$OPENSTACK_RELEASE --build-arg OPENSTACK_RELEASE=\$OPENSTACK_RELEASE ." # Install required packages file \ initscripts \ openstack-puppet-modules \ openstack-tripleo-image-elements \ openstack-tripleo-puppet-elements \ os-net-config \ python-heat-agent-puppet \ python-ipaddr \ python2-oslo-log openstack-ceilometer-compute \ openstack-neutron \ openstack-neutron-openvswitch \ openstack-nova-common \ openstack-nova-compute \ openvswitch \ python-nova CUR=$(pwd)for package in $(ls *.rpm); do rpm2cpio $package | cpio -ivd ./etc/* if [ -d 'etc' ]; then /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/docker-composeln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-puppet-elements/hiera/os-apply-config/etc/puppet/hiera.yaml \ /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/puppet/ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/ /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/os-net-config/ # Remove unnecessary packages yum remove gcc "*-devel" yum autoremove -y yum clean all
deleted_lines: echo "OPENSTACK_RELEASE=mitaka docker build -t tripleoupstream/heat-docker-agents:\$OPENSTACK_RELEASE --build-arg OPENSTACK_RELEASE=\$OPENSTACK_RELEASE ."yum install -y \ initscripts \ ethtool \ NetworkManager # We shouldn't need python-zaqarclient here for os-collect-config. # The rpm should pull it in but it's not doing that.. openstack-tripleo-puppet-elements \ openstack-tripleo-image-elements \ openstack-heat-templates \ openstack-puppet-modules \ os-apply-config \ os-collect-config \ os-refresh-config \ os-net-config \ python-zaqarclient \ openvswitch \ puppet \ python-ipaddr openstack-ceilometer-compute \ python-nova \ openstack-nova-common \ openstack-neutron \ openstack-nova-compute \ openstack-neutron-openvswitch CUR=`pwd`for f in $(ls *.rpm); do rpm2cpio $f | cpio -ivd ./etc/* if [ -d 'etc' ]; then# NOTE(flaper87): Remove unnecessary packages yum remove gcc "*-devel" yum autoremove -y yum clean all # Heat config setup. mkdir -p /var/lib/heat-config/hooks ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config-puppet/install.d/hook-puppet.py \ /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/puppet ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config-script/install.d/hook-script.py \ /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/script /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/docker-composeln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-puppet-elements/hiera/os-apply-config/etc/puppet/hiera.yaml /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/puppet/mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-image-elements/os-apply-config/os-refresh-config/configure.d/20-os-apply-config \ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d//usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config/os-refresh-config/configure.d/55-heat-config \ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d//usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d//usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/ mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/var/run/heat-config echo "{{deployments}}" > /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/var/run/heat-config/heat-config ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config/bin/heat-config-notify \ /usr/local/bin//usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/os-net-config/ mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/ ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-image-elements/os-collect-config/os-apply-config/etc/os-collect-config.conf \ /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc

commit_message:
Add roles-gate playbook run to OVB ci-script

The OVB gate was not picking up Gerrit changes.
This review adds the role-gate run to the ci-script
to incorporate the Gerrit change under test in the
Jenkins job run.

Change-Id: I3d733665d3b3819313cd7d2fc2615421263c71e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/73/392873/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # <playbook> \ # <job-type>JOB_TYPE=$8# preparation steps to run with the gated roles if [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "roles-gate" ] || [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "gate" ]; then # set up the gated repos and modify the requirements file to use them bash quickstart.sh \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --no-clone \ --bootstrap \ --requirements quickstart-extras-requirements.txt \ --playbook gate-roles.yml \ --release ${CI_ENV:+$CI_ENV/}$RELEASE${REL_TYPE:+-$REL_TYPE} \ $OPT_ADDITIONAL_PARAMETERS \ $VIRTHOST # once more to let the gating role be gated as well bash quickstart.sh \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --no-clone \ --bootstrap \ --requirements quickstart-extras-requirements.txt \ --playbook gate-roles.yml \ --release ${CI_ENV:+$CI_ENV/}$RELEASE${REL_TYPE:+-$REL_TYPE} \ $OPT_ADDITIONAL_PARAMETERS \ $VIRTHOST fi

commit_message:
Custom policy files

Allow operators to use their custom policy files.
Avoid maintain policy files in kolla repos, only copying
the files when an operator add their custom config.

Implements: blueprint custom-policies
Change-Id: Icf3c961b87cbc7a1f1dd2ffbfffcf271d151d862
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/02/391202/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if Policies shall be overwritten local_action: stat path="{{ node_custom_config }}/murano/policy.json" register: murano_policy - name: Copying over existing policy.json template: src: "{{ node_custom_config }}/murano/policy.json" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/murano/policy.json" when: murano_policy.stat.exists

subject: Improve usability of booting guest with SR-IOV
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-29 17:16:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/fcf6ec374850e515f8fc81bac7e3ba352039aa8f', 'message': 'Improve usability of booting guest with SR-IOV

This blueprint describes the addition of a new boot argument to the network
options in order to be able to specify a VIF model of type SR-IOV for network
attachments. This feature improves the usability of SR-IOV network devices.
Currently booting a guest with NIC SR-IOV attachment requires the user to
first create a Neutron port making it a multi-steps procedure.

Change-Id: I876463f9a043e189b8cb27e8c230d575da485da3
Implements: blueprint vif-model-sriov
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-12 17:18:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/fc30f0baf5fcf9dc431fbf021c752c079b4ea372', 'message': 'Improve usability of booting guest with SR-IOV

commit_message:
Improve usability of booting guest with SR-IOV

This blueprint describes the addition of a new boot argument to the
network options in order to be able to specify a VIF model of type
SR-IOV for network attachments. This feature improves the usability
of SR-IOV network devices.  Currently booting a guest with NIC SR-IOV
attachment requires the user to first create a Neutron port making it
a multi-steps procedure.

Change-Id: I876463f9a043e189b8cb27e8c230d575da485da3
Implements: blueprint vif-model-sriov
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/87/362287/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Improve usability of booting guest with SR-IOV ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/vif-model-sriov This blueprint describes the addition of a new boot argument to the network options in order to be able to specify a VIF model of type SR-IOV for network attachments. This feature improves the usability of SR-IOV network devices. Currently booting a guest with NIC SR-IOV attachment requires the user to first create a Neutron port making it a multi-steps procedure. Problem description =================== Nova supports attaching an SR-IOV NIC device to an instance. This process involves the creation of a Neutron port before launching a guest. For example, a user would do the following for booting an instance with an SR-IOV network device: :: $ NETID=`neutron net-list | grep default | awk '{print $2}'` $ neutron port-create $NETID --binding:vnic-type direct --name p-direct $ PORTID=`neutron port-list | grep "p-direct" | awk '{print $2}'` $ nova boot --image=guest.img --flavor=small --nic port-id=$PORTID guest0 This blueprint proposes to eliminate the intermediate step of creating a Neutron port by having Nova do the work on the behalf of the user. The goal is to improve the usability of booting instances with SR-IOV network devices. Better usability can limit errors (specifying wrong arguments) or limit race conditions (such as multiple instances trying to bind with the same port). This solution is also applicable to PF passthrough network device. Nova already creates neutron port for requested networks that are specified when spawning an instance. The use case of creating a neutron port for an SR-IOV network device (and PF passthrough) shouldn't then be treated any differently. The usability of nova should be consistent, whichever port type is used. Use Cases --------- A user wants to launch a guest with an SR-IOV network device (or a PF passthrough) and they want nova to create the neutron port for him like it does for any other type of ports. Proposed change =============== The proposed solution is to extend the Nova compute REST API to support an extra parameter ‘vif-model’ in the list of requested networks. The 'vif-model' is an opaque string. The value is a valid model: either 'vf' or 'pf'. The python-novaclient would be extended to support the new argument 'vif-model' that can be associated with each requested network specified ("--nic"). For example: :: $ nova boot --image=guest.img --flavor=small \ --nic net-id=$NETID,vif-model=vf guest0 Currently booting an instance with an SR-IOV port demands that a neutron port is pre-populated before requesting booting such an instance. The nova compute API then creates a corresponding PCI request for this particular port. The PCI request is then used by the scheduler for selecting a compute that has hardware resources to accommodate SR-IOV networking. In the end a PCI device (based on the PCI request) will be allocated on the target compute node. In the case that interests us, the same logic needs to be applied for guests that are specifying a vif-model 'vf' or 'pf'. Therefore we suggest that the nova compute API gets modified consistently. Meaning that the nova compute API will create a PCI requests for each of the network requested that are specified with the SR-IOV or a PF passthrough VIF model. The nova layer that interacts with neutron already supports the creation of ports following the requested networks specified when booting an instance. This piece of code will be modified for supporting port of type SR-IOV by specifying to neutron that the port is of type "{'binding:vnic_type': 'direct'}". Similarly, the port type for a PF passthrough would be "{'binding:vnic_type': 'direct-physical'}". If the VIF model is not specified when booting the instance, the default driver will then be used. For this proposal, the VIF model will only be implemented for libvirt. Once the framework is in place, it's relatively easy for another virtualization layer to use the VIF model information that is now stored with the instance. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The following changes are expected for the nova compute REST API: * The /v2.1/{tenant_id}/servers GET method needs to return the VIF models for an an instance. * The /v2.1/{tenant_id}/servers POST method needs to support the new ‘vif-model’ argument. The proposed change necessitate to add a new microversion to the REST API. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Changes in openstack are required. We recommend to only support this feature through the command line interface for now. But it's also possible to extend horizon as such. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ludovic.beliveau (ludovic.beliveau@windriver.com) Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Extend the Nova compute REST API. * Extend openstack client. * Change the nova.compute.API object to handle the creation of the PCI request. * Modify the nova.network.neutronv2.API. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= As usual, tox unit tests will have to be written to properly test this new feature. This feature can't be tested in a virtual environment and require servers with NIC that supports SR-IOV. Specific tests could most likely be added to the Intel PCI CI to validate the changes. Documentation Impact ==================== Since the nova REST API is impacted, the corresponding documentation will require to be changed (http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html). The Nova command line documentation also require changes (http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/nova.html). References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Mitaka - Introduced but no changes merged. * - ocata - Re-proposed.

commit_message:
Add option to disable "d1" Swift device

A default TripleO installation uses a local directory named "d1" to be
used by Swift. With SwiftRawDisks set it is highly unlikely that that an
operator wants to use this any longer, because it affects system
perforamce and might result in an overfilled the system disk. In this
case d1 should be no longer when building rings.

This patch makes it possible to disable the d1 device usage in the ring
building process by using a new option "SwiftUseLocalDir". This is set
by default to true, not changing the default behavior. If set to false,
the d1 device won't be used when building rings.

Closes-Bug: 1634051
Change-Id: Ia9ad38e3ffa533e170f4cedd0518d830e9b2fa69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/391222/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SwiftUseLocalDir: default: true description: 'Use a local directory for Swift storage services when building rings' type: boolean - {if: [{get_param: SwiftUseLocalDir}, [':%PORT%/d1'], []]} DEVICE: - {get_param: SwiftRawDisks}

commit_message:
Deploy monitoring/logging agents sooner

To be able to monitor during deployment, we need sensu clients
and fluentd collectors be deployed as soon as it is possible.

Change-Id: I952f0d6de6f6327d5c923b8f1d7a5979758dbc59
(cherry picked from commit 0ee53633d449e903e150622db9ea1aed77f550f1)

topology is used.

added_lines: - name: Ensuring the containers up kolla_docker: name: "{{ item.name }}" action: "get_container_state" register: container_state failed_when: container_state.Running == false when: inventory_hostname in groups[item.group] with_items: - { name: kibana, group: kibana } - include: config.yml - name: Check the configs command: docker exec {{ item.name }} /usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs --check changed_when: false failed_when: false register: check_results when: inventory_hostname in groups[item.group] with_items: - { name: kibana, group: kibana } # NOTE(jeffrey4l): when config_strategy == 'COPY_ALWAYS' # and container env['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] == 'COPY_ONCE', # just remove the container and start again - name: Containers config strategy kolla_docker: name: "{{ item.name }}" action: "get_container_env" register: container_envs when: inventory_hostname in groups[item.group] with_items: - { name: kibana, group: kibana } - name: Remove the containers kolla_docker: name: "{{ item[0]['name'] }}" action: "remove_container" register: remove_containers when: - config_strategy == "COPY_ONCE" or item[1]['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] == 'COPY_ONCE' - item[2]['rc'] == 1 - inventory_hostname in groups[item[0]['group']] with_together: - [{ name: kibana, group: kibana }] - "{{ container_envs.results }}" - "{{ check_results.results }}" - include: start.yml when: remove_containers.changed - name: Restart containers kolla_docker: name: "{{ item[0]['name'] }}" action: "restart_container" when: - config_strategy == 'COPY_ALWAYS' - item[1]['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] != 'COPY_ONCE' - item[2]['rc'] == 1 - inventory_hostname in groups[item[0]['group']] with_together: - [{ name: kibana, group: kibana }] - "{{ container_envs.results }}" - "{{ check_results.results }}"

subject: PCI: Fix PCI with fully qualified address
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 18:43:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3091baf5358dfa8a9428ea9628bffc7ee5b343d5', 'message': "PCI: Fix pci_passthrough_whitelist with fully qualified PF PCI address

Specifying a PF passthrough device in the pci_passthrough_whitelist using it's
fully qualified PCI address (no wildcard) causes the device to not be
properly loaded.  The PCI device is then not available to be assigned to any
guest.

In this case, the hypervisor reports the PF device without a 'parent_addr'.
But in the PciAddress, match() is using it when doing the comparison to it's
own address.

This commit changes the logic of the address matching method in PciDevSpec to
only try to match the address with a physical function device when a
'parent_addr' is reported by the hypervisor.

commit_message:
PCI: Fix PCI with fully qualified address

Specifying a PF passthrough device in the pci_passthrough_whitelist using its
fully qualified PCI address (no wildcard) causes the device to not be
properly loaded.  The PCI device is then not available to be assigned to any
guest.

In this case, the hypervisor reports the PF device without a 'parent_addr'.
But in the PciAddress, match() is using it when doing the comparison to its
own address.

This commit changes the logic of the address matching method in PciDevSpec to
only try to match the address with a physical function device when a
'parent_addr' is reported by the hypervisor.

Change-Id: I5255240871d8ad5c216500f39520339efe46e84b
Closes-Bug: #1613434
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/363884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace a test with use of network object

This patch is replacing some occurences of network and
subnet creation in a test with oslo versioned object use.
The scope of change is limited to extensions/test_l3_ext_gw_mode.py,
rest integrations would be done in separate patches

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Change-Id: I533d941fd74acc173f53a06a19cd33fa45b0d309
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/73/390673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.objects import network as net_obj self.network = net_obj.Network( self.context, project_id=self.tenant_id, self.network.create() self.int_net = net_obj.Network( self.context, project_id=self.tenant_id, self.int_net.create()
deleted_lines: self.network = models_v2.Network( tenant_id=self.tenant_id, self.context.session.add(self.network) # The following is to avoid complaints from SQLite on # foreign key violations self.context.session.flush() self.int_net = models_v2.Network( tenant_id=self.tenant_id, self.context.session.add(self.int_net)

subject: Implement first TripleO 3 nodes job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 20:40:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/66b1fd21621c975b11c4cbcbf928b16570dff673', 'message': 'Implement first TripleO 3 nodes job

For complex deployments (eg: High Availability, Network Isolation, etc),
2 nodes are not enough for TripleO as we deploy overcloud on a single
node.  We would like to extend our testing to test more realistic
deployments with one more node for the overcloud.

This patch does 2 things:
- Create centos-7-3-node in nodepool, that will run 2 subnodes.
- Implement experimental (non-voting) TripleO centos-7-ha-multinode

Change-Id: Ie204431d9a50dd8247d6393e916c5033ba0499d3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-03 20:41:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/5ae4f695e4d57ed42f2baf5decbe92ea6ef3a39f', 'message': 'Implement first TripleO 3 nodes job

For complex deployments (eg: High Availability, Network Isolation, etc),
2 nodes are not enough for TripleO as we deploy overcloud on a single
node.  We would like to extend our testing to test more realistic
deployments with one more node for the overcloud.

This patch does 2 things:
- Create centos-7-3-node in nodepool, that will run 2 subnodes.

commit_message:
Implement first TripleO 3 nodes job

For complex deployments (eg: High Availability, Network Isolation, etc),
2 nodes are not enough for TripleO as we deploy overcloud on a single
node.  We would like to extend our testing to test more realistic
deployments with one more node for the overcloud.

This patch does 2 things:
- Create centos-7-3-node in nodepool, that will run 2 subnodes.
- Implement experimental (non-voting) TripleO centos-7-3nodes-multinode

Change-Id: Ie204431d9a50dd8247d6393e916c5033ba0499d3

commit_message:
IPMI command should depend on console type

This change implements _get_impi_cmd method for
IPMI consoles. Depends on type of console,
ipmi command should contain different arguments.

Change-Id: I55e712a1a91aed3d533f636e519f0bae1f9be2d4
Closes-bug: #1611285
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/47/363647/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_ipmi_cmd(self, driver_info, pw_file): return ("/:%(uid)s:%(gid)s:HOME:ipmitool -H %(address)s -I lanplus " "-U %(user)s -f %(pwfile)s" % {'uid': os.getuid(), 'gid': os.getgid(), 'address': driver_info['address'], 'user': driver_info['username'], 'pwfile': pw_file}) ipmi_cmd = self._get_ipmi_cmd(driver_info, pw_file) def _get_ipmi_cmd(self, driver_info, pw_file): return ("ipmitool -H %(address)s -I lanplus " "-U %(user)s -f %(pwfile)s" % {'uid': os.getuid(), 'gid': os.getgid(), 'address': driver_info['address'], 'user': driver_info['username'], 'pwfile': pw_file})
deleted_lines: ipmi_cmd = ("/:%(uid)s:%(gid)s:HOME:ipmitool -H %(address)s" " -I lanplus -U %(user)s -f %(pwfile)s" % {'uid': os.getuid(), 'gid': os.getgid(), 'address': driver_info['address'], 'user': driver_info['username'], 'pwfile': pw_file})

Change workers in murano service

* engine workers moved from workers to engine_workers option in engine
  group.

commit_message:
make trove-dashboard use upper-constraints

Currently trove-dashboard installs (explicitly) unconstrained. Change
to be constrained by modifying pip_install to only support a
constrained option.

Change-Id: I6fcb5a90290faba1b64e7d1bf2b74087a0c759cd
Closes-Bug: #1623932

commit_message:
Log warning when user set improper config option value

User may set wrong values for live migration related config options,
log warning when setting with wrong values, will use parameter min
of IntOpt to enforce these config options' values in Pike.

Change-Id: I064958998939da3e05bd04631a36d2a507bf50c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/354532/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: downtime_min = nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_MIN steps_min = nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_STEPS_MIN delay_min = nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_DELAY_MIN if downtime < downtime_min: LOG.warning(_LE("Config option live_migration_downtime's value " "is less than minimum value %dms, rounded up to" "the minimum value."), downtime_min) downtime = downtime_min if steps < steps_min: LOG.warning(_LE("Config option live_migration_downtime_steps's " "value is less than minimum value %dms, rounded " "up to the minimum value."), steps_min) steps = steps_min if delay < delay_min: LOG.warning(_LE("Config option live_migration_downtime_delay's " "value is less than minimum value %dms, rounded " "up to the minimum value."), delay_min) delay = delay_min
deleted_lines: if downtime < nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_MIN: downtime = nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_MIN if steps < nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_STEPS_MIN: steps = nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_STEPS_MIN if delay < nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_DELAY_MIN: delay = nova.conf.libvirt.LIVE_MIGRATION_DOWNTIME_DELAY_MIN

Enable Gnocchi plugin in grafana

With this plugin, we can show the gnocchi data in grafana.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ib93ae79f1048566626f319063f4fcaec6f151a52

commit_message:
Configure run-validation to use the custom output

The validations now have a custom Ansible formatter that shows a better
report on the validation run, what failed and why, etc. This makes it
available to our Mistral workflows.

Change-Id: Iebe26e3e2922dafc7f93837c4315cebf14563f6d
Depends-On: I9730f2dd04868c5de46ae90bd545865d17aec530
Closes-Bug: #1625526
(cherry picked from commit c25c30bb0be55c6aa180e0ba1d0858e0d0b890fa)

commit_message:
Controller event handling pipeline

This patch introduces ControllerPipeline which is an entry point
handler for the Kuryr-Kubernetes controller. ControllerPipeline
allows registering ResourceEventHandlers and ensures the proper
handler is called for each event that is passed to the
ControllerPipeline. Also it ensures the following behavior:

- multiple ResourceEventHandlers can be registered for the same
  resource type (OBJECT_KIND)

- failing handlers (i.e. ones that raise Exceptions) are retried
  until either the handler succeeds or a finite amount of time
  passes, in which case the most recent exception is logged

- in case there are multiple handlers registered for the same
  resource type, all such handlers are considered independent (i.e.
  if one handler fails, other handlers will still be called
  regardless; and the order in which such handlers are called is not
  determined)

- events for different Kubernetes objects can be handled concurrently

- events for the same Kubernetes object are handled sequentially in
  the order of arrival

Change-Id: Ib17e0c7a2790cdbc31be4f59d50972b43c272480
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/36/391336/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from kuryr_kubernetes.handlers import asynchronous as h_async from kuryr_kubernetes.handlers import dispatch as h_dis from kuryr_kubernetes.handlers import k8s_base as h_k8s from kuryr_kubernetes.handlers import logging as h_log from kuryr_kubernetes.handlers import retry as h_retry LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class ControllerPipeline(h_dis.EventPipeline): """Serves as an entry point for controller Kubernetes events. `ControllerPipeline` is an entry point handler for the Kuryr-Kubernetes controller. `ControllerPipeline` allows registering :class:`kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.k8s_base.ResourceEventHandler`s and ensures the proper handler is called for each event that is passed to the `ControllerPipeline`. Also it ensures the following behavior: - multiple `ResourceEventHandler`s can be registered for the same resource type (`OBJECT_KIND`) - failing handlers (i.e. ones that raise `Exception`s) are retried until either the handler succeeds or a finite amount of time passes, in which case the most recent exception is logged - in case there are multiple handlers registered for the same resource type, all such handlers are considered independent (i.e. if one handler fails, other handlers will still be called regardless; and the order in which such handlers are called is not determined) - events for different Kubernetes objects can be handled concurrently - events for the same Kubernetes object are handled sequentially in the order of arrival """ def __init__(self, thread_group): self._tg = thread_group super(ControllerPipeline, self).__init__() def _wrap_consumer(self, consumer): # TODO(ivc): tune retry interval/timeout return h_log.LogExceptions(h_retry.Retry(consumer)) def _wrap_dispatcher(self, dispatcher): return h_log.LogExceptions(h_async.Async(dispatcher, self._tg, h_k8s.object_uid))

commit_message:
fix connection context manager in rc cache

This patch changes the context manager call in the _refresh_from_db()
method from this:

with ctx.session.connection() as conn:

to this:

with db_api.api_context_manager.reader.connection.using(ctx):

This is necessary to prevent errors about using a closed connection that
surfaced when writing a functional test case that tested that deleting a
custom resource class when inventory is associated with that custom
resource class.

Change-Id: I844d00028281ccbbfa527cd77469592fe1d7c151

commit_message:
Enable proxy headers parsing for Neutron

http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware was recently added to Neutron [1] and
in order to take it into use, we need to enable it via hiera.

[1] Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b
Depends-On: I99bc9486fdd85857ce73c413e17400320bd6ec5b
Related-Bug: #1590608

Change-Id: I10c065e726f2708e09acfc04dac3cae34a534d23

commit_message:
API: lookup() ignore malformed MAC addresses

This patch is adding code to ignore malformed MAC addresses which are
called as part of the lookup() mechanism. Prior to this patch, if a MAC
address wasn't in the expected format (six octets) the deployment of the
node would fail because the ramdisk wouldn't be able to lookup which
node it was in the Ironic database. One way to trigger this problem was
to deploy a node with an Infiniband Card which the MAC address (or GID)
contains 20 octets, that would result in a deployment failure even when
that NIC wasn't used by Ironic at all (not enrolled as a port).

The ListOfMacAdresses type was also deleted as part of this patch
because it wasn't used anywhere else.

Change-Id: I614fe63236985438d2f354d17a15d17649e72912
Closes-Bug: #1633585
(cherry picked from commit e0fd53d1830a76e8eb99be899b8302769b4fa649)

commit_message:
Move storage_address discovery into a single task

The storage address variable needs to be defined before running other
common tasks. The `storage_address` variable, when defined in a cinder
storage backend, causes an exception at runtime as the host_var will be
undefined. This patch moves the `storage_address` discovery set of tasks
into its one task and allows the option to be known before running
anything else.

Closes-Bug: #1632393
Change-Id: I547c72943396af92df2a298470e3f89b4d1e3a2d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix BaseException.message deprecation messages

When running inventory tests locally on Python 2.7.12, the following
warning was displayed for some tests:

/home/nrb/projects/openstack-ansible/tests/test_inventory.py:565:
DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of
Python 2.6

This change updates references to exception.message to use the str
method of access, which is the replacement.

A __str__ method was also added the LxcHostsDefined exception to be more
consistent.

Change-Id: I75fd2da4a31b75916f10502134913c8bacbc34f0

commit_message:
Fix the ctlplane-ip-range validation

This adds "become: true" to the undercloud.conf task, because that file
may not always be accessible by the validations user.

Closes-Bug: #1637254
Change-Id: Ibb0f43d3e0d4d7a663f1f21f7e0ba30e0cd203dc
(cherry picked from commit 6899fe0fe38f3e4593b685be8a73788e5c7b96cf)

commit_message:
libvirt: sync time on resumed from suspend instances

Time is not being synchronized for migrated or resumed from suspend instances
as guest.resume() method is not being called on these operations.

Calling sync_guest_time directly in the resume method as well as in
finish_migration.

Resolves-Bug: #1636565

Change-Id: Ie140bc0912e6b312d3fcbee7e9650a81076eda4d

commit_message:
Disable SMT for ppc64 hypervisor and set VNC

On ppc64le KVM hypervisor SMT is enabled by default.
Adding the task to disable SMT to allow launching the instance in
running state.

Setting the default console type as noVNC for ppc64 arch.

Change-Id: I119455a499255725dd616eb488a1c67f828d925a
(cherry picked from commit 55c89fc11842ea6c008fc4b592d3b7077e801eef)

commit_message:
Suppress use of the default gateway provided by Undercloud

This change is meant to disable use of the default gateway provided
by the Undercloud DHCP so that it can be configured to point at
different IPs, for the different roles, in the os-net-config templates.

Change-Id: I840c4345bdf39d08f76e30ec70127974c53d29c2

commit_message:
Fixing 'test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk' test

The 'test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk' test has been recently
broken by the patch [1]. The traceback can be found in logs of the
'gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh' job [2]. The test fails with error [3].

When we create a flavor with no ephemeral disk, the 'ephemeral' argument
is unexpected. So we don't need to pass the 'ephemeral' argument to the
'create_flavor' method when we create a flavor with no ephemeral disk.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390198/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/98/390198/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh/fef3bfd/logs/testr_results.html.gz
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/587678/

Change-Id: I0cdbba827640d09d7b1fb8e1f3c0b56013a5d3a6

commit_message:
Set the AIO to use bootstrap_host_public_interface

This patch namespaces the variables 'public_interface' and
'encapsulation_interface' to prevent any clashes, and sets
the AIO networking to configure the masquerade rules to use
'bootstrap_host_public_interface' as the interface it uses
instead of hard-coding it to eth0.

This allows testing with hosts which don't have eth0.

Change-Id: I9a494ae5290a2218cf8c8d2cd44b27fd7264313f

subject: Revert "setup: build config file at build time"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 07:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'gnocchi/genconfig.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/7e54f67ab6640624e5c3e49fd8428bfd8e3c24d4', 'message': 'Revert "setup: build config file at build time"

Generating the config file at build time is a bit fragile and depends on
how the setup is run (pip, setup.py install, setup.py develop).

For example, pip run bdist_wheel and that fail bdist, both
run the build_py hook. During the bdist_wheel only build dependencies
are available (only pbr for us), so that fail. In our case, it doesn't
because we ignore the exception. Even we block the wheel generation,
bdist will fail too if not all generators dependencies are present.

Perhaps revert this is more secure to ensure we have the configuration
file even it's not up2date.

This reverts commit 17ca48a387f3670d9ac78c4bdebade08c9dba479.

Change-Id: If39c06f8d6101494953813b3fda25f3c7aea9e96
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "setup: build config file at build time"

Generating the config file at build time is a bit fragile and depends on
how the setup is run (pip, setup.py install, setup.py develop).

For example, pip run bdist_wheel and that fail bdist, both
run the build_py hook. During the bdist_wheel only build dependencies
are available (only pbr for us), so that fail. In our case, it doesn't
because we ignore the exception. Even we block the wheel generation,
bdist will fail too if not all generators dependencies are present.

Perhaps revert this is more secure to ensure we have the configuration
file even it's not up2date.

This reverts commit 17ca48a387f3670d9ac78c4bdebade08c9dba479.

Change-Id: If39c06f8d6101494953813b3fda25f3c7aea9e96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/37/386437/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import generator def sdist_prehook(sdist): generator.main(['--config-file', 'etc/gnocchi/gnocchi-config-generator.conf'])
deleted_lines: def prehook(cmd): try: from oslo_config import generator generator.main(['--config-file', 'etc/gnocchi/gnocchi-config-generator.conf']) except Exception as e: print("Unable to build sample configuration file: %s" % e)

commit_message:
Change HAProxy timeouts to match the defaults

The queue client and server timeouts changed for the swift-proxy
endpoint in the haproxy manifest. So we need the validations to
match those.

Change-Id: I1bdf62a0e984d1c3b6ea63e8678b0dc88d0c2caf

commit_message:
undercloud-disk-space.yaml: improved output

- constant defining number of B in one GB replaced by a fact const_bytes_in_gb
  which is defined in set_fact
- float value defining disk space rounded to one decimal place

Change-Id: I9a6bc642cb55e31a0e930a19b9faffb3130fa859

commit_message:
Add RHEL-07-010430 and RHEL-07-010431

This patch disables automatic and timed logins in gdm only if gdm
is installed and configured.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I34c1f91deb20441d8ca577f38d44c30c05718205

added_lines: status: implemented tag: sshdThe ``PermitEmptyPasswords`` configuration will be set to ``no`` in ``/etc/ssh/sshd_config`` and sshd will be restarted. This disallows logins over ssh for users with a empty or null password set. Deployers can opt-out of this change by setting the following Ansible variable: .. code-block:: yaml security_sshd_disallow_empty_password: no
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Update api-ref, dev-docs to be accurate for Newton

Some commits updating the api-ref and dev-docs to indicate the
deprecated status of the Images v1 API did not make it into the
Newton RC.  This patch updates those docs so there's no confusion
about the status of the v1 API.

See this ML thread for more context:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/104859.html

This patch:
- marks the Images v1 API as DEPRECATED in the api-ref
- updates the 'versions' response in the api-ref to be correct for
  Newton (v1 deprecation, v2 minor version bump)
- adds a "version history" to the api-ref
- adds a deprecation note to the developer docs

Closes-bug: #1629503
(cherry picked from commit 0a9bbd33c0295d972ad90b0bc118f3b1b472c885)
(cherry picked from commit cd65bfd0c7f8527a551050f1a9b275cfa75a97a1)
(cherry picked from commit 5ac85fdd75076c59844f058978111bd2a6a6c292)

Change-Id: I396cc172831d9d59ab7f50ef8c9de7170fbc4944

commit_message:
Fix modify_fields_from_db for vif_details empty str

vif_details is represented as an empty string in our DB schema
when it's not defined. The 'modify_fields_from_db' method was
incorrectly attempting to feed this directly into the json decoder.

Closes-Bug: #1638703
Change-Id: I7b13fb30de71bb4dce4dbab4ffe430e1d0ef8f3a

commit_message:
Blacklist rtslib-fb 2.1.60/61

These have an unconditional dep on pyudev without declaring it, causing
test failures. PR with fix submitted:
  https://github.com/open-iscsi/rtslib-fb/pull/81

Change-Id: Ib1256be6f3c74256eda5766ec92de85ad7f44aa6

commit_message:
Fix noop rspec tests for openstack-cinder

We need to adjust openstack-cinder rspec test according to recent
changes related to os_workers fact:
I5cc4d70b902eeaa1c9cf42911606eba13dd84aa2

Disabling system tests synce this patch affects only noop tests.
Fuel-CI: disable

Change-Id: I94a0d48ead045bb84e5afb1a7bc5c904dc4cbe01

commit_message:
Install configuration files for all downloaded packages

Previously, the script installed the configuration files only for the
packages with the name starting with openstack, and the heat-agents
image was missing config files for libvirt and such.

subject: WIP: Add DNSSEC draft spec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-03 15:36:08.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/dnssec.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs/commit/688ff45b0d5ba9f30b70e0e18b0f2b9c2abeca10', 'message': 'WIP: Add DNSSEC draft spec

Change-Id: If2df46af0bf49b12287156fe3becefd07171ab8b
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add DNSSEC draft spec

Change-Id: If2df46af0bf49b12287156fe3becefd07171ab8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/71/132571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= DNS Security Extensions ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/dnssec Problem description =================== DNSSEC is designed the prevent the possibility resolvers receiving forged DNS responses, as well as mitagate DNS cache poisoning attacks. Additionally, DNSSEC provides some unexpected advantages by providing a authenticated mechanism of distrubuting data relted to a zone - for example, DANE. Terms ===== +--------+--------------------------+ | Name | Description | +========+==========================+ | DNSSEC | DNS Security Extensions | +--------+--------------------------+ | KSK | Key Signing Key | +--------+--------------------------+ | ZSK | Zone Signing Key | +--------+--------------------------+ | HSM | Hardware Security Module | +--------+--------------------------+ Proposed change =============== A DNSSEC implementation in Designate will be broken down into two core parts: 1. Key Management 2. Zone Signing Key Management -------------- DNSSEC requires two different keys, a Key Signing Key (KSK) and a Zone Signing Key (ZSK). The KSK is a long life key (~1yr), while the ZSK is a short life key (~1d - 1mo). The KSK's public component is published upstream in the TLD or ccTLD zone as a DS key record and requires our end users involvement to rotate. As such, we have no way to automatically rotate this key. We must however provide the necessary tooling to allow our users to rotate this key. The ZSK's public component is published is published locally in the root of the signed zone as a DNSKEY record. Rotating ZSK's can be done without end user involvement. Persistent Key storage will be offloaded to Barbican, which is turn ideally backed by a HSM to ensure no possible exposure of keys at rest. Key rollover, or replacement, is a fairly involved process with may gaps and time delays to allow for zone replication and cache expiry. Below, we include a sample process for replacing both the ZSK and KSK's. There are alternative methods, such as dual-signing, but these are not dicussed. ZSK Rollover ~~~~~~~~~~~~ Outlined below is the ZSK rollover process for reference: 1) Generate a new ZSK 2) Add the new ZSK's DNSKEY record to the zone and sign using the old ZSK 3) Wait for 2x the TTL of the DNSKEY RRSet 4) Resign the zone using the new ZSK 5) Wait for 2x the TTL of the DNSKEY RRSet 6) Remove the old ZSK's DNSKEY record from the zone KSK Rollover ~~~~~~~~~~~~ Outlined below is the KSK rollover process for reference: 1) Generate a new KSK 2) Publish the new KSK's DS record to the TLD or ccTLD zone 3) Wait for 2x the TTL of the DS RRSet 4) Replace the DNSKEY record for the old KSK with the new KSK's record 5) Re-sign the zone 6) Wait for 2x the TTL of the DS RRSet 7) Remove the old KSK's DS record to the TLD or ccTLD zone Zone Signing ------------ We have two options here: 1) Pre-Signing. Sign the Zone upon each change made via the API. 2) On-Demand Signing. Sign the Zone at mDNS upon AXFR. Pre-Signing ~~~~~~~~~~~ The "pre-signing" option would involve each API call (or other zone update) triggering the full zone to be re-signed. This re-signing MUST happen before mDNS serves an AXFR to a slave nameserver, and ideally must happen in the same database transaction as the a zone modifcations which triggered the need to re-sign. This option has two major disadvantages: 1) It is currently unknown how DNSSEC signing will affect our IXFR plans. 2) All create/update/delete API calls, or dynamic DNS updates, would have significant additional user visible latency introduced. 3) Pre-signed zones would need to have the RRSIG, NSEC3, etc RRSets stored in the database, each unique RRSet name would cause the addition of two new matching RRSets for storage of DNSSEC signatures. An update to a single Record in the zone would cause all RRSIG and NSEC3 records to be regenerated and persisted. On-Demand Signing ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The "on-demand signing" option would involve each AXFR from mDNS triggering a zone signing. This will add latency to the mDNS transaction, but is preferable to user visible latency. The result of this process may be cached in, for example, memcached for reuse when other slave nameservers AXFR. The effectiveness of this cache is debateable, as it's likely many slave nameservers will request an AXFR of the same zone at roughtly the same time. The CPU effect of zone-signing in Python should be relativly minimal, as the core cryptography methods are implemented in C by PyCrypto, and as all the necessary data is already loaded by the mDNS service in order to respond to the AXFR request. This option has several major disadvantages: 1) It is currently unknown how DNSSEC signing will affect our IXFR plans. 2) This option is likely to be more CPU heavy, as each zone may need to be simultaneously signed multiple times by different mDNS servers. 3) If two mDNS servers simultaneously sign a zone, **the generated RRSig and NSEC3 RRSets will differ**. It is believed this will not pose a real-world problem, as the DNSSEC specs have allowed for validations to occur even when partial zone data has been cached by resolvers. Next Steps ---------- There's likely 100 other advantages and disadvantages to each approach. Let's use this session to try work them out, and reach a concensus on the appropriate direction to take. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Unassigned Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo/L(?) Dependencies ============ - No known dependencies Useful References ================= * http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System_Security_Extensions * http://www.iana.org/assignments/dns-sec-alg-numbers/dns-sec-alg-numbers.xhtml

subject: Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 05:42:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-monascaclient/commit/8345a265a2d8eca9ea2b454ca4ff31bd9c5a3455', 'message': "Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Idf4237a687433acd5dc8a1eb8740195ac5968818
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-12 05:52:53.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/v2_0/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-monascaclient/commit/7e0f07ad489a768a4df1a544957719e7558d8b73', 'message': "Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Idf4237a687433acd5dc8a1eb8740195ac5968818
"}]
commit_message:
Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Idf4237a687433acd5dc8a1eb8740195ac5968818
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-monascaclient refs/changes/83/385283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I0393c9e1b193ea2a8f73b9be2b79e19c47e43fcd

Closes-bug: #1639111

commit_message:
Update subport host_id when remove trunk port

Currently removing a vm which boot with trunk port.
The neutron-server side won't update the port host_id. So this
period, the trunk subports' binding info is not same with the
parent port.

This patch make the agent to update the bind info of subports
during processing trunk remove action.

Change-Id: I763cf89dd0f5732ae1e070ec53595cbca7831231
Closes-bug: #1639111
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/393568/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_subports = list() for s in subport_ids: update_subports.append({ 'trunk_id': trunk_id, 'port_id': s }) self.trunk_rpc.update_subport_bindings(self.context, update_subports)

commit_message:
Ensure X-Auth-All-Projects header value is a string

Header values are strings so we should provide a string as
X-Auth-All-Projects header value instead of a boolean (which is
transformed into: "<type 'bool'>" by python-requests)

Change-Id: Id4172f424565da5afb1f310195a0b7ba37674064

subject: Adding the ability to call a function when the job is timed out
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 14:51:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/cbfea20c55c56d5fee5a93462c100cbd414d80ab', 'message': "Adding the ability to call a function when the job is timed out

This is a simple patch to add the possibility to call a function when
the job timeout.
Some CI's relay on devstack-vm-gate-wrap, and this will enable third
party to collect some logs needed to debug for example, even when the
job timeout. This is very important to understand how and why the job
is failing.
Example of use: tripleo periodic jobs are failing with timeout and
there's some tempest failures, however, the logs are not being uploaded
because the way tripleo works, collect the logs script isn't being
executed, which makes hard to identify the root cause and find a
solution.
Besides, this won't interrupt or make it fails any job upstream, because
the jobs are not implementing the 'post_timeout_hook' function.

Change-Id: I9d06e0686c589c9b513e5cab4d39b87e2dd34c4c
"}]
commit_message:
Adding the ability to call a function when the job is timed out

This is a simple patch to add the possibility to call a function when
the job timeout.
Some CI's relay on devstack-vm-gate-wrap, and this will enable third
party to collect some logs needed to debug for example, even when the
job timeout. This is very important to understand how and why the job
is failing.
Example of use: tripleo periodic jobs are failing with timeout and
there's some tempest failures, however, the logs are not being uploaded
because the way tripleo works, collect the logs script isn't being
executed, which makes hard to identify the root cause and find a
solution.
Besides, this won't interrupt or make it fails any job upstream, because
the jobs are not implementing the 'post_timeout_hook' function.

Change-Id: I9d06e0686c589c9b513e5cab4d39b87e2dd34c4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/70/391870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Run post_timeout_hook if we have one call_hook_if_defined "post_timeout_hook"

commit_message:
Add a validator for neutron networks

This patch add a new validator to check if the user set the
nics and net-id in the json or yaml config file.

Change-Id: If572d8a97e240822e395a05df9f6da3e3d5dba85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/13/141813/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @validator def required_neutron_network(config, clients, task): """Validator checks if network id is set in the config.""" nics = config.get("args", {}).get("nics") if not nics or len(nics) == 0: return ValidationResult(False, "Nics is missing") for nic in nics: if not nic.get('net-id'): message = "Nics is set, but there's no net-id" return ValidationResult(False, message) return ValidationResult()

validation user might not be able to read it.

commit_message:
Fix the rabbitmq-limits validations

The validation fails because the rabbitmqctl command needs to be run as
root. This adds "become: true" to the task to fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1637260
