commit_message:
Decrease cache sync time in inspector discovery job

We are deleting node from ironic for simulate node discovery,
so it's possible race when node cache become inconsistency.

This change decrease period time from default 60 to 5 sec to avoid
cache inconsistency.

Change-Id: I6af4dc6acebb673d256940278ca94a657774cdf9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/93/393193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # we are deleting node from ironic for simulate node discovery, # so inspector has to sync cache asap export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_CLEAN_UP_PERIOD=5"

commit_message:
Remove create / pushSignedTag from release-managed

The release team now handles all release tasks for all official
OpenStack projects, including creating branches and pushing
signed tags. Some projects had leftover rights from when they
handled those tasks directly. Clean those up in order to
streamline ACLs across official projects.

Change-Id: I61169f872b077c57772442772b74b6313318dfd0

commit_message:
Use dummy share driver of manila with rally CI jobs

For the moment we use two different share back ends for two existing
Rally CI jobs that run against manila project. It is redundant, as in
case of CI we intend to test main manila functionality, that is
back end agnostic. So, switch them to 'dummy' share driver and
disable all other redundant services, that also will reduce deployment
time.

Change-Id: I753a648349f7a3b8ede3ee714657638f4db68ec5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/36/393436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Run only manila services, because only main manila functionality # will be tested with 'dummy' share driver that does not use real # storage back ends. Also, it will speed up devstack installation. export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=key,mysql,rabbit driver: 'dummy' driver: 'dummy'

subject: Remove non-voting requirements check job from cisco plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 16:43:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/92900cc7dabf645b7e56657f9c5dc0353e664d8f', 'message': 'Remove non-voting requirements check job from cisco plugin

The requirements check job template is meant to be voting on
both check and gate should a repo choose to use the template.

Exceptions to this usage cause confusion and cargo culting.

No repo is required to run the requirements check job template
but should they choose to they are expected to use it as intended.

The requirements check job template is needed for a project to be

The requirements check job template is needed for a project to be

Change-Id: I5c1938a8069f8848069f5d30ce82aa010a84f569
'}]
commit_message:
Remove non-voting requirements check job from cisco plugin

The requirements check job template is meant to be voting on
both check and gate should a repo choose to use the template.

Exceptions to this usage cause confusion and cargo culting.

No repo is required to run the requirements check job template
but should they choose to they are expected to use it as intended.

The requirements check job template is needed for a project to be
added to global requirements.

Change-Id: I5c1938a8069f8848069f5d30ce82aa010a84f569

commit_message:
Add undercloud job to tripleo-ui and puppet-tripleo

With I6cab4d2f00ed16b2afaef120c845e5fea49fb29c a sanity check to ensure
the UI loads correctly will be added to the undercloud CI job. The two
projects most likely to cause issues with the UI loading are tripleo-ui
and puppet-tripleo, therefore the undercloud job should be added to
their pipeline before we merge the new CI check.

Change-Id: Ie2211c744157971c3500970c2df2a1d8ae4a83e9
Related: blueprint tripleo-ui-basic-ci-check

commit_message:
puppet: move scenario004 to gate

scenario004 was experimental until now. This scenario is useful to test
integration between OpenStack and Ceph Rados Gateway.
In this scenario, we test Glance using Swift backend pointing to Ceph
RGW API, with IPv6 and SSL.

Change-Id: I190d57ef756637f1f4e0316b00063344a093bf7c

commit_message:
Add OS::Zaqar::Subscription resource

Closes-Bug: #1628693
Change-Id: Ifb15bdfea2ff04c1f0fb1f890582c7e9d12b6db9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/15/392315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.common import exception from heat.common.i18n import _ from heat.engine import attributes from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import resource class ZaqarSubscription(resource.Resource): """A resource for managing Zaqar subscriptions.""" default_client_name = "zaqar" PROPERTIES = ( NAME, SUBSCRIBER, TTL, OPTIONS, ) = ( 'name', 'subscriber', 'ttl', 'options', ) ATTRIBUTES = ( ID, ) = ( 'id', ) properties_schema = { NAME: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Name of the queue to subscribe to."), required=True), SUBSCRIBER: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("URI of the subscriber which will be notified. Must be in the " "format: <TYPE>:<VALUE>."), required=True, update_allowed=True), TTL: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.INTEGER, _("Time to live of the subscription in seconds."), required=True, update_allowed=True), OPTIONS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, _("Options used to configure this subscription."), required=False, update_allowed=True) } attributes_schema = { ID: attributes.Schema( _("ID of the subscription.") ), } VALID_SUBSCRIBER_TYPES = ['http', 'https', 'mailto', 'trust+http', 'trust+https'] def validate(self): subscriber_type = self.properties[self.SUBSCRIBER].split(":")[0] if subscriber_type not in self.VALID_SUBSCRIBER_TYPES: msg = (_("The subscriber type of must be one of: %s.") % ", ".join(self.VALID_SUBSCRIBER_TYPES)) raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) def handle_create(self): """Create a subscription to a Zaqar message queue.""" subscription = self.client().subscription( self.properties[self.NAME], subscriber=self.properties[self.SUBSCRIBER], ttl=self.properties[self.TTL], options=self.properties.get(self.OPTIONS), auto_create=False ) self.resource_id_set(subscription.id) def _get_subscription(self): return self.client().subscription( self.properties[self.NAME], id=self.resource_id, auto_create=False ) def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): """Update a subscription to a Zaqar message queue.""" subscription = self._get_subscription() subscription.update(prop_diff) def handle_delete(self): pass # See bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1637304 def _resolve_attribute(self, name): if name == self.ID: return self.resource_id def _show_resource(self): subscription = self._get_subscription() return subscription.__dict__ def parse_live_resource_data(self, resource_properties, resource_data): return { self.NAME: resource_data[self.NAME], self.SUBSCRIBER: resource_data[self.SUBSCRIBER], self.TTL: resource_data[self.TTL], self.OPTIONS: resource_data[self.OPTIONS] } def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Zaqar::Subscription': ZaqarSubscription, }

commit_message:
FalconStor: Fix creating snapshot failed

To create snapshot fail when the display name exceeds 32 characters.
So we change the snapshot naming solution from snapshot display name to
snapshot id and shrink it for FSS limitation.

Change-Id: I48de678242c6b200ee46dae44b7b964493f60e29
Closes-Bug: #1637044

deleted_lines: Multi Node Environment ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ In a multi-node devstack environment where controller, network and compute nodes are separate, some neutron agents should not be installed in the controller node. In such cases, use the following local.conf setting to disable neutron agents in the controller node:: [[local|localrc]] TACKER_NEUTRON_AGENTS=''

commit_message:
Remove last vestiges of oslo-incubator

This is a community goal for Ocata.  We're already not using any of
the code, but there are some other files and references left over.

Change-Id: I37cff5c0cd0864430423ccaa7c115fd8817febe4
Partial-Bug: #1639103

commit_message:
Use internal endpoint when creating flavors

To avoid issues with self signed certs, particularly in AIO deployments,
use the internal endpoint when creating nova flavors.

Change-Id: I951d9abba91a31409d03a4d3f03d9990d949a864

commit_message:
bagpipe: rely on ROUTER_INTERFACE registry callbacks

This change replaces the code trying to detect new router
interfaces based on PORT create/update notifications, by code simply
listening on ROUTER_INTERFACE created/deleted notifications.

Change-Id: Ibab3ab2adfc636d4a48775ea7e9ac7ffdf53dcdf
Closes-Bug: 1629358
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/91/381091/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e): LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e}) registry.subscribe(self.registry_router_interface_created, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, registry.subscribe(self.registry_router_interface_deleted, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.AFTER_DELETE) def notify_router_interface_created(self, context, router_id, net_id): LOG.debug("notify_router_interface_created, router %s on network %s", router_id, net_id) router_assocs = get_router_bgpvpn_assocs(context, router_id) LOG.error(msg % {'rtr': router_id, def notify_router_interface_deleted(self, context, router_id, net_id): LOG.debug("notify_router_interface_deleted, router %s on network %s", router_id, net_id) router_assocs = get_router_bgpvpn_assocs(context, router_id) self.notify_port_updated(context, port['id'], original_port) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) self.notify_port_deleted(context, port_id) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) def registry_router_interface_created(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): router_id = kwargs.get('router_id') net_id = kwargs['port']['network_id'] self.notify_router_interface_created(context, router_id, net_id) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) @log_helpers.log_method_call def registry_router_interface_deleted(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): try: context = kwargs.get('context') # for router_interface after_delete, in stable/newton, the # callback does not include the router_id directly, but we find # it in the port device_id router_id = kwargs.get('port').get('device_id') net_id = kwargs['port']['network_id'] self.notify_router_interface_deleted(context, router_id, net_id) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e)
deleted_lines: # REVISIT(tmorin): if/when port ABORT_DELETE events are implemented # we will have to revisit the issue, so that the action done after # BEFORE_DELETE is reverted if needed (or a different solution) registry.subscribe(self.registry_port_created, resources.PORT, def router_interface_added(self, context, port): net_id = port['network_id'] LOG.debug("router_interface_added on network %s", net_id) router_assocs = get_router_bgpvpn_assocs(context, port['device_id']) LOG.error(msg % {'rtr': port['device_id'], def router_interface_removed(self, context, port): net_id = port['network_id'] LOG.debug("router_interface_removed on network %s", net_id) router_assocs = get_router_bgpvpn_assocs(context, port['device_id']) # TODO(tmorin): bagpipe driver # currently listen on Port AFTER_DELETE notification, a point # at which a router interface is not yet deleted from the db # hence, it will not be able to correctly inform the agent # that the gateway is gone # we thus force gateway_mac to None in the call below # This hack should be removed once we rely on the # ROUTER_INTERFACE AFTER_DELETE event rtr_itf_added = self._is_router_intf_added(original_port, port) rtr_itf_removed = self._is_router_intf_added(port, original_port) if rtr_itf_added: self.router_interface_added(context, port) elif rtr_itf_removed: self.router_interface_removed(context, original_port) else: self.notify_port_updated(context, port['id'], original_port) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e}) def _is_router_intf_added(self, original_port, port): if not (original_port and port): # This happens when the ml2 rpc.py sends a port update # notification. original port will be None. However, this rpc # notification will never be from a port device_id/device_owner # update, so return False return False return (original_port['device_owner'] != const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF == port['device_owner']) port = self._get_port(context, port_id) if port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF: self.router_interface_removed(context, port) else: self.notify_port_deleted(context, port_id) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e}) def registry_port_created(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): port = kwargs.get('port') if port and port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF: self.router_interface_added(context, port) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("Error during notification processing " "%(resource)s %(event)s, %(trigger)s, " "%(kwargs)s: %(exc)s"), {'trigger': trigger, 'resource': resource, 'event': event, 'kwargs': kwargs, 'exc': e})

commit_message:
Remove dead code about node check/recover

This patch removes dead code about node check/recover.

Change-Id: I9e028f8df74c4a65977f282453e4f0d72a8b2503
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/56/393156/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_node_check(self, mock_find, mock_action, mock_start): mock_find.return_value = mock.Mock(id='12345678AB') mock_action.return_value = 'ACTION_ID' params = {} result = self.eng.node_check(self.ctx, 'FAKE_NODE', params) self.assertEqual({'action': 'ACTION_ID'}, result) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_NODE') mock_action.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, '12345678AB', consts.NODE_CHECK, name='node_check_12345678', cause=action_mod.CAUSE_RPC, status=action_mod.Action.READY, inputs={}) mock_start.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') def test_node_check_not_found(self, mock_find): mock_find.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='node', id='Bogus') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.node_check, self.ctx, 'Bogus') self.assertEqual(exc.ResourceNotFound, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual('The node (Bogus) could not be found.', six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'Bogus') @mock.patch.object(dispatcher, 'start_action') @mock.patch.object(action_mod.Action, 'create') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') def test_node_recover(self, mock_find, mock_action, mock_start): mock_find.return_value = mock.Mock(id='12345678AB') mock_action.return_value = 'ACTION_ID' params = {'foo': 'bar'} result = self.eng.node_recover(self.ctx, 'FAKE_NODE', params) self.assertEqual({'action': 'ACTION_ID'}, result) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_NODE') mock_action.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, '12345678AB', consts.NODE_RECOVER, name='node_recover_12345678', cause=action_mod.CAUSE_RPC, status=action_mod.Action.READY, inputs={'foo': 'bar'}) mock_start.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') def test_node_recover_not_found(self, mock_find): mock_find.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='node', id='Bogus') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.node_recover, self.ctx, 'Bogus') self.assertEqual(exc.ResourceNotFound, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual('The node (Bogus) could not be found.', six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'Bogus') @mock.patch.object(dispatcher, 'start_action') @mock.patch.object(action_mod.Action, 'create') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find')

commit_message:
rest: empty search query in resource search

resource search should support empty query. Right now, if the query is
not passed at all the api returns all of the resources. but with empty
query, i.e. {}, it breaks.

Change-Id: I5f85bae0b710b67e6cbd0c3165666cf09c17e759

commit_message:
Fix target ID display when listing actions

The target ID is supposed to be shown in a short format by default, but
recent changes to SDK has broken this. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ie0df7b66bb00bb0ad95023e85594146a0356cc7d

commit_message:
Pass the the custom cacert to nova and heat client

It is not enough to add the custom certificate to the keystone client
for a successful overcloud node query within tripleo-ansible-inventory.

Change-Id: I852c1fee5c375332bdd4a45c846676f2d4cdefb1

commit_message:
[WIP] Pass all role data to the jinja2 template

This commit makes the variable passed to the jinja2 template more
consistent bewteen *.role.j2.yaml and *.j2.yaml rendering.

Previously, only the name of the role was passed to the *.role.j2.yaml
templates making it impossible to do templating based on the role's
data.

This commit requires changing the `role` variable in *.role.j2.yaml
templates into `role.name`.

Change-Id: Id1d0d4e393661f4e246159373cf82cb870db1697
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/70/386470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update stable branch example

The stable/juno branch was deleted 11 months ago:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-announce/2015-December/000869.html

Update the example to Newton, which should keep it valid for a while.

Change-Id: I4cd8738862a529fd319be2ec5694d00defd94f84

deleted_lines: following to create a juno OpenStack cloud: git checkout stable/juno

commit_message:
Change an attribute name from 'type' to 'type_name'

In client side, we have to use 'type_name' to get a value of profile type.
At the moment angular profile table doesn't show Profile Type because of
being using 'type'. So, this patch will change an attribute name.

Change-Id: I71d979ba8441b9aee66ffc82ebc2bdbabe58ad7a

commit_message:
Add setting file for enabling Angularized panel

To enable Angularized panel, we should prepare the sample setting
file and give the guidance to developer for using it.

Also, refresh README.rst for Devstack installing.

Change-Id: I95ac3fc3859bcfcb8f53546fd0c78b6dbc669622

commit_message:
add some tests for cluster and clustertemplate api

Change-Id: I9d08912aeb023dfc9cfeb7a18f9d8176712a6ead
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/82/387782/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: del cluster_template_dict['registry_enabled'] del cluster_template_dict['tls_disabled'] del cluster_template_dict['public'] del cluster_template_dict['server_type'] del cluster_template_dict['master_lb_enabled'] del cluster_template_dict['floating_ip_enabled'] self.assertFalse(cluster_template.registry_enabled) self.assertFalse(cluster_template.tls_disabled) self.assertFalse(cluster_template.public) self.assertEqual('vm',cluster_template.server_type) self.assertFalse(cluster_template.master_lb_enabled) self.assertTrue(cluster_template.floating_ip_enabled) def test_get_one_by_uuid(self): temp_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() obj_utils.create_test_cluster_template(self.context, uuid=temp_uuid) response = self.get_json( '/clustertemplates/%s' % temp_uuid) self.assertEqual(temp_uuid, response['uuid']) def test_get_one_by_uuid_not_found(self): temp_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() response = self.get_json( '/clustertemplates/%s' % temp_uuid, expect_errors=True) self.assertEqual(404, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertTrue(response.json['errors'])

commit_message:
Update Dockerfiles for footer related changes

Updated remaining <<service-base>> Dockerfiles to
include the footer block
Updated all relevant Dockerfiles to remove unnamed
footer blocks

Change-Id: Ic1fdab7fc35679d6581115ed570dbc0a029c904b
Partially-implements: blueprint third-party-plugin-support

commit_message:
Remove dead code after migrating cluster-collect

This removes the code deprecated by the v2 implementation of
cluster-collect.

Change-Id: Iabae7bbccc9995dc73b4523de151e4ece6d014ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/98/393598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(nm.Node, 'load_all') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') def test_cluster_collect(self, mock_find, mock_load): x_cluster = mock.Mock(id='FAKE_CLUSTER') mock_find.return_value = x_cluster x_node_1 = mock.Mock(id='NODE1', physical_id='PHYID1') x_node_1.to_dict.return_value = {'name': 'node1'} commit_message:
Add config option to create networks with port_security_enabled

The port_security extension in neutron is disabled by default.

devstack enables the port_security extension for ML2 but since
it's optional we shouldn't assume it's enabled, so this change
adds a configuration option to tell us if port security is
supported as a networking feature.

We could use the extension list but that defaults to all and
we shouldn't require tempest users to have to maintain a
whitelist of extensions just to make the default configuration
work with default neutron, i.e. not devstack.

This is also slightly different from the allow_port_security_disabled
option which is a temporary flag until liberty end of life at
which point nova can handle booting a server and attaching a
port with port security disabled.

To make this run in the integrated gate, devstack will need to
set CONF.network_feature_enabled.port_security=True in all
branches except stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I1efd5c838aa0d73cc6e8864e3041eea25850198d
Closes-Bug: #1624082
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/92/371092/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Closes-Bug: #1630611
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: k8s cluster creation with lb enabled/fip disabled

Fixed creation of k8s cluster with enabled loadbalancer
and disabled floating ip. This was caused because of wrong
reference of heat resource in disable_floating_ip.yaml:-

Wrong: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::Pool::FloatingIP
Correct: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::FloatingIP

Change-Id: I6ff1c43ab7f48b22b9f52ee09aa20284a28975b1
Closes-Bug: #1630611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/23/393323/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Modify force-delete to delete attached volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 18:33:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d13c4e0dceca8000db5a3fff20e8359b2d7544f3', 'message': 'Modify force-delete to query nova for attachments

Failures in communication between nova and cinder and result in an
instance being deleted but the attached volume is not properly marked
as detached and cannot be deleted.

Force-delete is modified to query nova to check if any existing
attachments exist for the volume and if none exists, delete the volume.

attachments exist for the volume and if none exists, delete the volume.

Change-Id: I2877a317e62a992246f19a4ae11c0e37125f50cd
Co-Authored-By: Stefan Dinescu <stefan.dinescu@windriver.com>
Closes-bug: 1636978

commit_message:
Modify force-delete to delete attached volumes

Failures in communication between nova and cinder and result in an
instance being deleted but the attached volume is not properly marked
as detached and cannot be deleted.

Force-delete is modified to delete attached volumes.

Change-Id: I2877a317e62a992246f19a4ae11c0e37125f50cd
Co-Authored-By: Stefan Dinescu <stefan.dinescu@windriver.com>
Closes-bug: 1636978
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/91/391291/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder.compute import nova if volume['attach_status'] == "attached": # Volume is still attached, need to detach it first # In some cases, the nova instance is deleted, but the message # doesn't reach cinder and the volume thinks it's still attached. # In case of a force-delete, we call nova to check if the attached # instance is actually present. As a safety measure, the deletion # continues only if nova return that the instance is actually gone. # For any other exception, we cancel the deletion. if force: LOG.info(_LI('Forcing volume deletion on id %s. ' 'Checking if the volume is still ' 'attached to nova instances.'), volume.id) attachments = volume['volume_attachment'] volume_can_be_deleted = True for attachment in attachments: instance_uuid = attachment['instance_uuid'] try: nova.API().get_server(context, instance_uuid) volume_can_be_deleted = False except exception.ServerNotFound: LOG.info(_LI('Nova instance %s ' 'not found for volume %s.'), instance_uuid, volume.id) except exception.APITimeout: volume_can_be_deleted = False LOG.error(_LE('Nova API Timeout ' 'for instance %s.'), instance_uuid) except Exception as e: LOG.error(_LE('Nova API exception. ' 'Exception type: %s'), type(e).__name__) volume_can_be_deleted = False if not volume_can_be_deleted: LOG.info(_LI('Volume %s is still attached ' 'or could not get instances'), volume.id) raise exception.VolumeAttached(volume_id=volume.id) else: LOG.info(_LI('Volume %s has no more attachments. ' 'Deleting'), volume.id) for attachment in attachments: self.detach(context, volume, attachment.id) volume.update({'attach_status': 'detached'}) volume.save()

commit_message:
simplejson much faster than default json module

with bug/1533337, simplejson support was removed. but simplejons much
faster than native json module.

This change uses simplejson if available.

Change-Id: I42da31bbb1d6344914e8f46a7b3e4c5ec1ebf79b
Related-Bug: 1533337

commit_message:
check size constraint in cluster action layer

move the size limitation check from node action layer
to cluster action layer. The size check in node action layer
is not needed.

Change-Id: I0bc694fb7358a3c6e5f6c43f5fe8085bbbb4e0e4

commit_message:
Changed the start script name in cinder-volume

In the Dockerfile of cinder-volume, the "kolla_extend_start" script
will be overwritten, and it will cause the cinder-volume container
doesn't create /var/log/kolla/cinder folder.
The name of the start script should be "kolla_cinder_extend_start" in
cinder-volume container.

Change-Id: I7251792a4fbe1442e2ffc5ebd9e41bd9cdc33568
Closes-Bug: #1638839

commit_message:
Fix bridge setup when using Virtualbox additions

The environment for client-side scripts when called by osbashauto is not
exactly the same as when they are executed over ssh. It is the same user
(osbash), but the PATH differs and does not contain /sbin.

This patch adds the full path for brctl so the program is found on
Windows hosts (or other hosts using osbashauto) as well.

Change-Id: I23790ad4c5ac1b2f5e6afd2ee2e786abc7a51797
(cherry picked from commit b11bea604ec240a1a16076f509b62af1d70d7a1d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/82/393582/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix bridge setup when using Virtualbox additions

The environment for client-side scripts when called by osbashauto is not
exactly the same as when they are executed over ssh. It is the same user
(osbash), but the PATH differs and does not contain /sbin.

This patch adds the full path for brctl so the program is found on
Windows hosts (or other hosts using osbashauto) as well.

Change-Id: I23790ad4c5ac1b2f5e6afd2ee2e786abc7a51797

commit_message:
Add missing deprecation warning in admin guide, manage project security

In manage project security section, all the commands are deprecated and
will be removed after Nova 15.0.0. But the admin guide shows no clue
of this. This patch adds such warning to every command.

Besides, it also fixes the output of $ nova secgroup-list

Change-Id: Iafcc55bf70d17dad0d10be45af38ad4e3ef8b775
Closes-Bug: #1628766
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/32/379132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

mock.Mock(type='FAKE_TYPE_2') ] origin_node = mock.Mock(id='ORIGIN', cluster_id='1234', ACTIVE='ACTIVE', status='ACTIVE', profile_id='FAKE_ID') replace_node = mock.Mock(id='REPLACE', cluster_id='', ACTIVE='ACTIVE', status='ACTIVE', profile_id='DIFF') mock_node.side_effect = [origin_node, replace_node] ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_replace_nodes, self.ctx, 'CLUSTER', nodes=nodes) self.assertEqual(exc.ProfileTypeNotMatch, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("Profile type of nodes ['REPLACE'] do not " "match that of the cluster.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER') mock_profile.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'FAKE_ID'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'DIFF')]) mock_node.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'ORIGIN'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'REPLACE')])

API support to cluster-replace-nodes v2

API layer revision to use objectified RPC parameter passing.

commit_message:
Engine layer cluster-replace-nodes v2

This adds support to cluster-replace-nodes v2 that can accept requests
in oslo versioned object format. This patch also reworks some existing
test cases for cleaning.

Change-Id: Iff903388bb649db996042728b53b26448e97cbe8

do it res = self.eng._validate_replace_nodes(self.ctx, cluster, {'OLD_NODE': 'NEW_NODE'}) self.assertEqual({'OLD_ID': 'NEW_ID'}, res) mock_node.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'OLD_NODE'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'NEW_NODE'), ]) mock_profile.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'FAKE_ID'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'FAKE_ID_1') ]) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test__validate_replace_nodes_old_missing(self, mock_profile, mock_node): c = mock.Mock(id='CID', profile_id='FAKE_ID') mock_node.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='node', id='OLD') # do it ex = self.assertRaises(exc.BadRequest, self.eng._validate_replace_nodes, self.ctx, c, {'OLD': 'NEW'}) self.assertIn("Original nodes not found: ['OLD']", six.text_type(ex)) mock_node.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'OLD') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test__validate_replace_nodes_new_missing(self, mock_profile, mock_node): c = mock.Mock(id='CID', profile_id='FAKE_ID') mock_node.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(), exc.ResourceNotFound(type='node', id='NEW') ] # do it ex = self.assertRaises(exc.BadRequest, self.eng._validate_replace_nodes, self.ctx, c, {'OLD': 'NEW'}) self.assertIn("Replacement nodes not found: ['NEW']", six.text_type(ex)) mock_node.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'OLD'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'NEW') ]) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test__validate_replace_nodes_old_not_member(self, mock_profile, mock_node): c = mock.Mock(id='CID', profile_id='FAKE_ID') mock_node.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(cluster_id='OTHER'), mock.Mock(cluster_id=''), ] # do it ex = self.assertRaises(exc.BadRequest, self.eng._validate_replace_nodes, self.ctx, c, {'OLD': 'NEW'}) self.assertIn("The specified nodes ['OLD'] to be replaced are not " "members of the cluster CID.", six.text_type(ex)) mock_node.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'OLD'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'NEW') ]) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test__validate_replace_nodes_new_not_orphan(self, mock_profile, mock_node): c = mock.Mock(id='CID', profile_id='FAKE_ID') mock_node.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(cluster_id='CID'), mock.Mock(cluster_id='OTHER'), ] # do it ex = self.assertRaises(exc.NodeNotOrphan, self.eng._validate_replace_nodes, self.ctx, c, {'OLD': 'NEW'}) self.assertIn("Nodes ['NEW'] already member of a cluster.", six.text_type(ex)) mock_node.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'OLD'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'NEW') ]) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test__validate_replace_nodes_new_bad_status(self, mock_profile, mock_node): c = mock.Mock(id='CID', profile_id='FAKE_ID') mock_node.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(cluster_id='CID'), mock.Mock(cluster_id='', status=consts.NS_ERROR), ] # do it ex = self.assertRaises(exc.BadRequest, self.eng._validate_replace_nodes, self.ctx, c, {'OLD': 'NEW'}) self.assertIn("Nodes are not ACTIVE: ['NEW'].", six.text_type(ex)) mock_node.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'OLD'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'NEW') ]) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test__validate_replace_nodes_new_profile_type_mismatch( self, mock_profile, mock_node): c = mock.Mock(id='CID', profile_id='FAKE_CLUSTER_PROFILE') mock_profile.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(type='FAKE_TYPE'), # for cluster mock.Mock(type='FAKE_TYPE_1'), # for node ] mock_node.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(cluster_id='CID'), mock.Mock(cluster_id='', status=consts.NS_ACTIVE, profile_id='FAKE_NODE_PROFILE'), ] # do it ex = self.assertRaises(exc.ProfileTypeNotMatch, self.eng._validate_replace_nodes, self.ctx, c, {'OLD': 'NEW'}) self.assertIn("Profile type of nodes ['NEW'] do not match that of " "the cluster.", six.text_type(ex)) mock_node.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'OLD'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'NEW') ]) mock_profile.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'FAKE_CLUSTER_PROFILE'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'FAKE_NODE_PROFILE') ]) @mock.patch.object(am.Action, 'create') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, '_validate_replace_nodes') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'node_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') @mock.patch.object(dispatcher, 'start_action') def test_cluster_replace_nodes2(self, notify, mock_find, mock_profile, mock_node, mock_validate, mock_action): cluster = mock.Mock(id='CID', profile_id='FAKE_ID') mock_find.return_value = cluster mock_profile.return_value = mock.Mock(type='FAKE_TYPE') old_node = mock.Mock(id='ORIGIN', cluster_id='CID', status='ACTIVE') new_node = mock.Mock(id='REPLACE', cluster_id='', status='ACTIVE', profile_id='FAKE_ID_1') mock_node.side_effect = [old_node, new_node] mock_action.return_value = 'ACTION_ID' param = {'ORIGINAL': 'REPLACE'} mock_validate.return_value = param req = orco.ClusterReplaceNodesRequest(identity='CLUSTER', nodes=param) # do it res = self.eng.cluster_replace_nodes2(self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) # verify self.assertEqual({'action': 'ACTION_ID'}, res) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER') mock_validate.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, cluster, param) mock_action.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, 'CID', consts.CLUSTER_REPLACE_NODES, name='cluster_replace_nodes_CID', cause=am.CAUSE_RPC, status=am.Action.READY, inputs={'ORIGINAL': 'REPLACE'}) notify.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, '_validate_replace_nodes') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') def test_cluster_replace_nodes2_failed_validate(self, mock_find, mock_chk): nodes = {'OLD': 'NEW'} cluster = mock.Mock() mock_find.return_value = cluster mock_chk.side_effect = exc.BadRequest(msg='failed') req = orco.ClusterReplaceNodesRequest(identity='CLUSTER', nodes=nodes) # do it ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_replace_nodes2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: failed.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER') mock_chk.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, cluster, nodes)

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2016-06-09 18:43:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6b26bb8c56034202c492892c27c3efabae7f7292', 'message': 'objects: switch base plugin class to using subnetpool object

Among non-obvious changes, the base object class was extended to allow
for additional filter hook generation. This is needed to support
timestamp based filter (changed_since) that is available for subnetpools
and other standardattributes based objects.

In addition, description field in standardattributes object extension is
now nullable, as in the database. This changes object hashes, but we
should be safe to touch it without providing a new object version
conversion rules because affected objects are not yet exposed to RPC
anywhere.

To avoid object API complexity, base class added support for
get_objects() keyword arguments that are not of list type (in which
case, we pass a single entry list down into _get_collection).

Also, some unit tests were changed to pass correct UUIDs for tenants, to
avoid validation warnings triggered by strict typing for subnetpool
project_id field.

commit_message:
objects: switch base plugin class to using subnetpool object

Among non-obvious changes, description field in standardattributes object
extension is now nullable, as in the database. This changes object hashes,
but we should be safe to touch it without providing a new object version
conversion rules because affected objects are not yet exposed to RPC
anywhere.

To avoid object API complexity, base class added support for
get_objects() keyword arguments that are not of list type (in which
case, we pass a single entry list down into _get_collection).

Also, some unit tests were changed to pass correct UUIDs for tenants, to
avoid validation warnings triggered by strict typing for subnetpool
project_id field.

Depends-On: I1c1bf544af4463b0302b62c8cce492932504bb01
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I1415c7a29af86d377ed31cce40888631a34d4811

[WIP] Integration of NetworkDhcpAgentBinding OVO

This patch will replace the use of NetworkDhcpAgentBinding  model
with NetworkDhcpAgentBinding OVO from objects/networks.py

commit_message:
objects: Removed project_id/tenant_id field translation

In Ocata, project_id is already in DB, no need to translate
the tenant_id to project_id when accessing Subnet entries.

Change-Id: I095d544c9d00bbf3908850edb380ecfa0dbaeda2
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
objects: add validate_filters option for count() method.

Since we are passing filters for count(), we have to add the choice
if count() method should validate or not the filters provided
(filters can be parsed from REST API).

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I3fd354db63fa27eb8992d951cc74014b693991c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/30/376430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_count_validate_filters_false(self): if not isinstance(self._test_class, base.NeutronDbObject): self.skipTest('Class %s does not inherit from NeutronDbObject' % self._test_class) expected = 10 with mock.patch.object(obj_db_api, 'count', return_value=expected): self.assertEqual(expected, self._test_class.count(self.context, validate_filters=False, fake_field='xxx')) def test_count_validate_filters_false(self): for fields in self.obj_fields: self._make_object(fields).create() self.assertEqual( len(self.obj_fields), self._test_class.count(self.context, validate_filters=False, fake_filter='xxx'))

commit_message:
objects: Remove tenant_id from to_dict() when project_id is not set.

Current implementation will raise AttributeError when some object
will not have project_id set, but will call to_dict()/items() method.

This is affecting 7ba5b4ef259476b6f48b21d78c8d560bfb5be167.
This should not affect Newton.

Change-Id: If0c00aa5630fe575378ec3c8a2f17d7333951ae6
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/49/384949/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_to_dict_with_unset_project_id(self): if 'project_id' not in self._test_class.fields: self.skipTest( 'Test class %r has no project_id in fields' % self._test_class) obj_data = copy.copy(self.obj_fields[0]) obj_data.pop('project_id') obj = self._test_class(self.context, **obj_data) dict_ = obj.to_dict() if self._test_class.fields['project_id'].nullable: self.assertIsNone(obj.project_id) else: self.assertRaises(AttributeError, getattr, obj, 'project_id') self.assertFalse('project_id' in dict_) self.assertIsNone(dict_['tenant_id'])

deleted_lines: def save_allocation_pools(self, context, subnet, allocation_pools): ip_pool = models_v2.IPAllocationPool(subnet=subnet, subnet = self._save_subnet(context, network, self._make_subnet_args( subnet_request, subnet, subnetpool_id), subnet['dns_nameservers'], subnet['host_routes'], subnet_request) return subnet, None

commit_message:
SUPER WIP OVO port object

Introduce the ovo Port object, PortBinding and IPAllocation.
AllowedAddressPair is the only extension enabled in this patch,
the others will follow.

TODO list
2) find a way to model port binding. There are few classes for
port binding, we need a way to handle that in the port object.
3) include the port extensions (port security, sec groups) once
they get merged
4) use the port object in the code base
5) add more tests

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Change-Id: Ie8ef777887ba027add7dd11958696581da8014fc
Co-Authored-By: Martin Hickey <martin.hickey@ie.ibm.com>

commit_message:
objects: rename tenant_id field to project_id for trunks

All occurrences of tenant term should be replaced with projects in the
tree. This patch renames the field from Trunk object. We are safe to do
it without bumping the object version for now because it's not exposed
on the wire so far.

Change-Id: Ied9d51e9f8f69246d9dc80c882cc5e11cef01b2b
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

commit_message:
OVO for Router Extra Attributes

This patch introduces OVO for Router Extra Attributes

Co-Authored-By: Anindita Das <anindita.das@intel.com>

Change-Id: I6b3114005715aa8197aa7188bd92611be886a20c
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/66/356766/35 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.objects import router_extra_attributes as router_extra_attrs for attr in extra_attributes)) self, context, router_db, router_req): attributes_db = router_extra_attrs.RouterExtraAttributes( context, router_id=router_db['id'], **kwargs) attributes_db.create()
deleted_lines: import sqlalchemy as sa from sqlalchemy import orm from neutron.db import model_base class RouterExtraAttributes(model_base.BASEV2): """Additional attributes for a Virtual Router.""" # NOTE(armando-migliaccio): this model can be a good place to # add extension attributes to a Router model. Each case needs # to be individually examined, however 'distributed' and other # simple ones fit the pattern well. __tablename__ = "router_extra_attributes" router_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('routers.id', ondelete="CASCADE"), primary_key=True) # Whether the router is a legacy (centralized) or a distributed one distributed = sa.Column(sa.Boolean, default=False, server_default=sa.sql.false(), nullable=False) # Whether the router is to be considered a 'service' router service_router = sa.Column(sa.Boolean, default=False, server_default=sa.sql.false(), nullable=False) ha = sa.Column(sa.Boolean, default=False, server_default=sa.sql.false(), nullable=False) ha_vr_id = sa.Column(sa.Integer()) # Availability Zone support availability_zone_hints = sa.Column(sa.String(255)) router = orm.relationship( 'Router', backref=orm.backref("extra_attributes", lazy='joined', uselist=False, cascade='delete')) for attr in extra_attributes)) self, context, router_db, router_req): attributes_db = RouterExtraAttributes( router_id=router_db['id'], **kwargs) context.session.add(attributes_db)

added_lines: from neutron.objects import base as obj_base from neutron.objects import l3_hamode as l3_obj query = l3_obj.L3HARouterVRIdAllocation.get_objects( context, network_id=network_id) allocated_vr_ids = set(a.vr_id for a in query) - set([0]) allocation = l3_obj.L3HARouterVRIdAllocation( context, network_id=network_id, vr_id=available_vr_ids.pop()) allocation.create() except obj_base.NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntry: obj = l3_obj.L3HARouterVRIdAllocation.get_object( context, network_id=ha_network.network_id, vr_id=vr_id) if obj: obj.delete()
deleted_lines: query = (context.session.query( l3_hamode_model.L3HARouterVRIdAllocation). filter(l3_hamode_model.L3HARouterVRIdAllocation .network_id == network_id)) allocated_vr_ids = set(a.vr_id for a in query) - set([0]) allocation = l3_hamode_model.L3HARouterVRIdAllocation() allocation.network_id = network_id allocation.vr_id = available_vr_ids.pop() context.session.add(allocation) except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry: context.session.query(l3_hamode_model .L3HARouterVRIdAllocation).filter_by( network_id=ha_network.network_id, vr_id=vr_id).delete()

commit_message:
Request object for replace nodes request

Versioned object for cluster_replace_nodes call. The request object
leverages the UniqueDict field type for validation.

Change-Id: I38033aba360482e5421ff94c0be7121a22a7fe8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/23/393123/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestClusterReplaceNodes(test_base.SenlinTestCase): def test_init(self): sot = clusters.ClusterReplaceNodesRequest( identity='foo', nodes={'old1': 'new1', 'old2': 'new2'}) self.assertEqual('foo', sot.identity) self.assertEqual({'old1': 'new1', 'old2': 'new2'}, sot.nodes) def test_init_missing_value(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterReplaceNodesRequest, identity='foo', nodes={'old1': None, 'old2': 'new2'}) self.assertEqual("Field `nodes[old1]' cannot be None", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_duplicated_nodes(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterReplaceNodesRequest, identity='foo', nodes={'old1': 'new2', 'old2': 'new2'}) self.assertEqual("Map contains duplicated values", six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Integration of Port Binding Level OVO in clear_binding_levels method in
neutron/plugin/ml2/db.py

This patch integrates OVO for Port Binding Level OVO in
clear_binding_levels method in /plugin/ml2/db.py and introduces context
for usuage in object operation.

Change-Id: I8aad3a0d5c7363bbddcd7bb8dce8223df76a495b
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/18/374418/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: db.clear_binding_levels(port_id=port_id, host=original_host) db.clear_binding_levels(port_id=port_id, host=original_host) db.clear_binding_levels(port_id=port_id, host=cur_binding.host) db.clear_binding_levels(port_id=port_id, host=binding.host)
deleted_lines: session = mech_context._plugin_context.session db.clear_binding_levels(session, port_id, original_host) db.clear_binding_levels(session, port_id, original_host) db.clear_binding_levels(session, port_id, cur_binding.host) session = mech_context._plugin_context.session db.clear_binding_levels(session, port_id, binding.host)

subject: Update instance node on rebuild only when it is recreate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 20:34:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/97d784b454baf3289ce2f3e1812fb94c8469b136', 'message': 'Update instance node on rebuild only when it is recreate

When using ironic virt driver, if scheduled_node is not specified
in rebuild_instance compute manager method (as it happens in case
of instance rebuild), the first ironic node is selected:

 computes = ComputeNodeList.get_all_by_host(context, host, use_slave)
 return computes[0]

After the first rebuild, instance.node is updated to be this first
ironic node, which causes subsequent rebuilds to fail, as virt driver
tries to set instance_uuid on a newly selected ironic node and fails.

Closes-bug: #1564921
Change-Id: I2fe6e439135ba6aa4120735d030ced31081ef202
(cherry picked from commit 54b122caec1ae2418fc3e296be604d072cb5815a)
'}]
commit_message:
Update instance node on rebuild only when it is recreate

When using ironic virt driver, if scheduled_node is not specified
in rebuild_instance compute manager method (as it happens in case
of instance rebuild), the first ironic node is selected:

 computes = ComputeNodeList.get_all_by_host(context, host, use_slave)
 return computes[0]

After the first rebuild, instance.node is updated to be this first
ironic node, which causes subsequent rebuilds to fail, as virt driver
tries to set instance_uuid on a newly selected ironic node and fails.

Closes-bug: #1564921
Change-Id: I2fe6e439135ba6aa4120735d030ced31081ef202
(cherry picked from commit 54b122caec1ae2418fc3e296be604d072cb5815a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/375715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if recreate: try: compute_node = self._get_compute_info(context, self.host) scheduled_node = compute_node.hypervisor_hostname except exception.ComputeHostNotFound: LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to get compute_info for %s'), self.host) else: scheduled_node = instance.node
deleted_lines: try: compute_node = self._get_compute_info(context, self.host) scheduled_node = compute_node.hypervisor_hostname except exception.ComputeHostNotFound: LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to get compute_info for %s'), self.host)

commit_message:
Add option to pass tags to the ansible hook

Currently we don't support options for the ansible hook, but it would
be useful to enable passing tags, like we already do for the puppet
hook.

Change-Id: Idf7e3aa520fd40a2c4c00b2d26c3c608059bb51d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/32/393432/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'options': {}, 'inputs': [ {'name': 'foo', 'value': 'bar'}, {'name': 'another', 'value': 'input'} ], 'config': 'the ansible playbook' } data_tags = { 'id': '1234', 'name': 'fake_resource_name_tags', 'group': 'ansible', 'options': {'tags': 'abc,def'}, self._hook_run() def test_hook_tags(self): self._hook_run(data=self.data_tags, options=['--tags', 'abc,def']) def _hook_run(self, data=None, options=None): [self.hook_path], self.env, json.dumps(data or self.data)) expected_args = [ self.fake_tool_path, '-i', 'localhost,', ansible_playbook, '--extra-vars'] if options: expected_args += options expected_args.append('@%s' % vars_filename) self.assertEqual(expected_args, state['args'])

commit_message:
pci: remove pci device from claims and allocations when freeing it

In drop_move_claim we call free pci device when we need to drop a
specific device from the src/dest node. This is done by calling
pci manager free_device. The current code just update the device
status to available in database but doesn't remove it from the
pci manager claims and allocations lists. This patch adds the
removal as well.

Closes-Bug: #1622854

Change-Id: If1cd6f3a635759cd55d116a34ca164630c61e085
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/369180/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 14:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_lvm_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/95aa577e6c3b97673e1fb03f2be102ad7f6447be', 'message': 'Mock volume create for LVM migration tests

Two tests were failing with the os-brick 1.7.0 release due to
executing operations related to destination volume creation and
failing to parse the mock object as the expected results.

Since the actual volume creation is not relevant to the scope of
these unit tests, the create_volume internal calls should just be
mocked out.

Change-Id: I1099b1045d3192ee37064f0c12181fa96870b87d
Closes-bug: #1638861
'}]
commit_message:
Mock volume create for LVM migration tests

Two tests were failing with the os-brick 1.7.0 release due to
executing operations related to destination volume creation and
failing to parse the mock object as the expected results.

Since the actual volume creation is not relevant to the scope of
these unit tests, the create_volume internal calls should just be
mocked out.

Change-Id: I1099b1045d3192ee37064f0c12181fa96870b87d
Closes-bug: #1638861
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/44/393344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[install] Use openstack instead of neutron client

Update documentation for creating the provider network to use the
openstack client as opposed to the neutron client. Also updated the
output of the client after creating the network / subnet.

Change-Id: I1094ac695c23b1c1f03027677697fd90f0f1bace

commit_message:
Update docs for automated setup with vagrant

- Fix the link to the vagrant download page
- Update path to vagrant.conf.yml (now virtualbox.conf.yml)
- Update text to reflect that three VMs are started now instead of two

subject: Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism
revisions:

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Ie860ef9bc223621140205d465298c4009b86118a
(cherry picked from commit 47b5a171ca805135f675a1fee7f997a631480efb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/85/393385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix delete l2 goto l3 flow deleted twice

Change-Id: Id7710bb34138077cb3d135f9a19fb47e4a716c00
Closes-bug: #1638221
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/83/392083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: device_owner = lport.get_device_owner() if device_owner != common_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF: self._delete_dst_classifier_flow_for_port(network_id, mac) device_owner = lport.get_device_owner() if device_owner != common_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF: self._delete_dst_classifier_flow_for_port(network_id, mac) def _delete_dst_classifier_flow_for_port(self, network_id, mac): parser = self.get_datapath().ofproto_parser ofproto = self.get_datapath().ofproto match = parser.OFPMatch() match.set_metadata(network_id) match.set_dl_dst(haddr_to_bin(mac)) self.mod_flow( datapath=self.get_datapath(), table_id=const.L2_LOOKUP_TABLE, command=ofproto.OFPFC_DELETE, priority=const.PRIORITY_MEDIUM, match=match)
deleted_lines: match = parser.OFPMatch() match.set_metadata(network_id) match.set_dl_dst(haddr_to_bin(mac)) self.mod_flow( datapath=datapath, table_id=const.L2_LOOKUP_TABLE, command=ofproto.OFPFC_DELETE, priority=const.PRIORITY_MEDIUM, out_port=ofproto.OFPP_ANY, out_group=ofproto.OFPG_ANY, match=match) match = parser.OFPMatch() match.set_metadata(network_id) match.set_dl_dst(haddr_to_bin(mac)) self.mod_flow( datapath=datapath, table_id=const.L2_LOOKUP_TABLE, command=ofproto.OFPFC_DELETE, priority=const.PRIORITY_MEDIUM, out_port=ofproto.OFPP_ANY, out_group=ofproto.OFPG_ANY, match=match)

'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2016-07-11 12:47:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/1ac26873defbd703a3b162376fbe2711fa8c36c1', 'message': "Add QoS Functionality

Neutron's QoS framework support dragonflow as s third-party vendor to
provide QoS functionality.
In this patch, dragonflow implements
'neutron.services.qos.notification_drivers.qos_base', register its
specific driver information to the 'notification_drivers' stevedore
namespace in the setup.cfg and set the 'notification_drivers' parameter in
the [qos] section of the neutron config file.
This patch supports QoS create/update/delete operations, it also supports
a created QoS policy to associate with a neutron port or network.

Change-Id:I8ebebc40248374a424a14b93f186293a708c6b70

"}, {'number': 27, 'created': '2016-09-05 13:31:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/4abc9317eb898261e81be3929d88811917dab504', 'message': 'Add QoS North Bound Functionality

This patch provides a notification driver for QoS Plugin. QoS plugin can
notify the north bound messages to Dragonflow by the notification driver.
The north bound messages the patch supported are as follows:
1. Create QoS

commit_message:
Add QoS North Bound Functionality

This patch provides a notification driver for QoS Plugin. QoS plugin can
notify the north bound messages to Dragonflow by the notification driver.
The north bound messages the patch supported are as follows:
1. Create QoS
2. Update QoS
3. Delete Qos
4. Create port with QoS
5. Update port with QoS
6. Update network with QoS

coresponding spec:
Implements: blueprint qos-app

Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <honghui_xiao@yeah.net>
Co-Authored-By: xuxiaojie <xiaojie.xu@huawei.com>
Change-Id:I8ebebc40248374a424a14b93f186293a708c6b70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/32/331932/43 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_qos_policy(self, policy_id, topic, **columns): policy = {} policy['id'] = policy_id policy['topic'] = topic for col, val in columns.items(): policy[col] = val policy_json = jsonutils.dumps(policy) # When delete policy, topic(tenant_id) is not provided, so we must use # None as topic when create policy. If not, the policy can not be # deleted. self.driver.create_key('qospolicy', policy_id, policy_json, None) self._send_db_change_event('qospolicy', policy_id, 'update', policy_json, topic) def delete_qos_policy(self, policy_id, topic=None): self.driver.delete_key('qospolicy', policy_id, topic) self._send_db_change_event('qospolicy', policy_id, 'delete', policy_id, SEND_ALL_TOPIC) def get_qos_policy(self, policy_id, topic=None): try: qospolicy_value = self.driver.get_key('qospolicy', policy_id, topic) return QosPolicy(qospolicy_value) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE('Could not get qos policy %s'), policy_id) return None class QosPolicy(DbStoreObject): def __init__(self, value): self.qospolicy = jsonutils.loads(value) def get_id(self): return self.qospolicy.get('id') def get_name(self): return self.qospolicy.get('name') def get_topic(self): return self.qospolicy.get('topic') def get_version(self): return self.qospolicy.get('version') def get_rules(self): res = [] for rule in self.qospolicy.get('rules'): res.append(QosPolicyRule(rule)) return res def __str__(self): return self.qospolicy.__str__() class QosPolicyRule(DbStoreObject): def __init__(self, value): self.qosrule = value def get_id(self): return self.qosrule.get('id') def get_topic(self): return self.qosrule.get('topic') def get_max_burst_kbps(self): return self.qosrule['max_burst_kbps'] def get_max_kbps(self): return self.qosrule['max_kbps'] def get_dscp_marking(self): return self.qosrule['dscp_marking'] def __eq__(self, other): return self.get_id() == other.get_id() def __str__(self): return self.qosrule.__str__()

subject: Fix database poison warnings, part 24
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 14:56:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f7ed4b1b99be5d6ddb300ad0f783ce9cb931ea4d', 'message': 'Fix database poison warnings, part 24

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings (7 new ones) from:

    unit.compute.test_compute_mgr.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: Ibe23b977f24a2840eee6f8386d7c0bbbab6783fa
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 24

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings (7 new ones) from:

    unit.compute.test_compute_mgr.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: Ibe23b977f24a2840eee6f8386d7c0bbbab6783fa
Related-Bug: #1568414

This interface was defined initially, but never implemented.

commit_message:
Add nb_db_driver_clean support for nb db devstack

This interface was defined initially, but never implemented.
As a result, the devstack cannot clean up the nb db driver.

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I3b719139a143ed497ddcef29c54c2dcdf343cf64

Integration test for message receiver

This patch adds integration test for message receiver.

Depends-On: I57691bb37a0d48d00bb9981c900b04d55fbdb458
Change-Id: I631d37d09105deb459e2f2c0fef97dbdec1ebfd8

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest import test from senlin.tests.tempest.common import utils from senlin.tests.tempest.integration import base class TestReceiver(base.BaseSenlinIntegrationTest): @test.attr(type=['integration']) @decorators.idempotent_id('16902c7a-1057-49bb-aa9e-227297864a92') def test_message_receiver(self): # Create a message type of receiver receiver_id = utils.create_a_receiver(self, None, None, r_type='message') self.addCleanup(utils.delete_a_receiver, self, receiver_id) receiver = utils.get_a_receiver(self, receiver_id) queue_name = receiver['channel']['queue_name'] self.assertTrue(queue_name.startswith('senlin-receiver-'))

subject: Fix database poison warnings, part 23
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 13:32:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b85f235515f7a56a42a864ea7a5bdd3f0f7b7835', 'message': 'Fix database poison warnings, part 23

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings (12 new ones) from:

    nova.tests.unit.virt.ironic.test_driver.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I2f11c85a3fd192d93f010b781af60b78ff6914b9
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 23

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings (12 new ones) from:

    nova.tests.unit.virt.ironic.test_driver.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I2f11c85a3fd192d93f010b781af60b78ff6914b9
Related-Bug: #1568414

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

The tests/os_keystone-overrides.yml file is removed
as it is unnecessary given the merge of
https://review.openstack.org/381479

Depends-On: I0e6d43a9f22add78f693e8836f1dd852be74d6c5
Change-Id: Ief9c7f124eb58b986192b2f958c971197d410799
(cherry picked from commit c5a0cce3c695ccd6ecb594fc8b3148e085e9a5d2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/03/393203/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: fix incorrect host cpus giving to emulator threads when RT

Realtime guarantees in certain operating systems require that the
thread that is running the QEMU emulator is pinned to a physical CPU
that is *not* the same as any physical CPU that the vCPUs for a
realtime guest are pinned to. This patch ensures that the value of the
hw:cpu_realtime_mask flavor extraspec property is respected when
creating the libvirt configuration XML and sets emulatorpin values to
a physical CPU matching the hw:cpu_realtime_mask value.

Change-Id: I7f50dde0753b059a690dc50172fee645c94b8e5b
Closes-Bug: #1614054

commit_message:
Create magnum flavor using tempest role

Create the m1.magnum flavor by overriding the tempest_flavors variable
of the os_tempest role instead of shelling out to the nova client.

Change-Id: Ia9b28bc98d838e3e1bce49dc72700b1b2a7235b7

commit_message:
Remove df-ext-services

df-ext-services was introduced in [1] for rejoin stack, while rejoin
stack has been removed by devstack at [2].

Now, df-ext-services.sh will change every time run devstack. And it will
restart nb db unnecessarily when run devstack, according to current code.

Since it is not used by devstack, this patch removes df-ext-services.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/dragonflow/+bug/1510812
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291453/

Change-Id: I863afbed782aa24150c1a3cf9dc86ac99cb07da3
Closes-Bug: #1637686

commit_message:
Distinguish between low/high priority spec freeze

Manila actually has 2 spec freeze dates, a low and a high
priority one. To avoid confusion, document both on the
official schedule.

Change-Id: I6fd5a8e182ceaee237b48096d6dba2271a72e928

commit_message:
Pin designate-tempest-plugin SHA

To ensure that the plugin test does not have conflicting
requirements/constraints with stable/newton, the SHA is
pinned close to the tempest SHA pin.

Change-Id: Ic9958d3b21facfd6a2c0bf4db6d1fa1c5f25d0f5

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Ic7b9237a220344454fa449fff876c3aedd7c57d7

commit_message:
Speed up package install/removal

Instead of breaking up package installations and removals into separate
tasks, this patch moves them all under one task that does two execution
steps.

In addition, the security_enable_chrony variable was added to control the
installation and configuration of chrony. The tox tests for the role were
configured to skip chrony in the gate using a skipped tag, but this caused
the package install/removal task to get skipped.

Docs/release notes are included for the chrony change.

Change-Id: I1def033953b50be3911cd932fd17b10dd2c658b7

commit_message:
Fix group name of the image_ssh_user option

Option "image_ssh_user" from group "compute" is deprecated.
Use option "image_ssh_user" from group "validation".

Change-Id: If12caf3606a23f79fd92d58f8d391c773cb2abf2
Closes-Bug: #1638197

subject: Statically define the repo build concurrency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 15:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/0e01cef619e4af249ac7ee28f7ade5fcf3cf318e', 'message': 'Statically define the repo build concurrency

The repo build concurrency was pulling the processor core count and using
that int as the value for determining concurrent builds. Sadly,
this value can be high, low, or simply undefined and is entirely dependent
on the Ansible fact gathering system which has additional complexities and
dependencies based on how the hardware has represented the information.

Examples:
  * Should the value be low, 3 or less than, the build process would run
    serially making things painfully slow.
  * Should the value be high the build process may run too many tasks at
    one time causing general system instability.

This commit statically defines the concurrency level as "4" which is small
enough to support vagant, and minimal resource machines, while also being
performant enough to support large scale production clouds.

Change-Id: If2ad496c31c4d0092e7856c3deb07035ebc6c8b9
(cherry picked from commit 534f40f3dd890b6106e7783ea4dafee3457f3601)
'}]
commit_message:
Statically define the repo build concurrency

The repo build concurrency was pulling the processor core count and using
that int as the value for determining concurrent builds. Sadly,
this value can be high, low, or simply undefined and is entirely dependent
on the Ansible fact gathering system which has additional complexities and
dependencies based on how the hardware has represented the information.

Examples:
  * Should the value be low, 3 or less than, the build process would run
    serially making things painfully slow.
  * Should the value be high the build process may run too many tasks at
    one time causing general system instability.

This commit statically defines the concurrency level as "4" which is small
enough to support vagant, and minimal resource machines, while also being
performant enough to support large scale production clouds.

Change-Id: If2ad496c31c4d0092e7856c3deb07035ebc6c8b9
(cherry picked from commit 534f40f3dd890b6106e7783ea4dafee3457f3601)

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Icdd5d053346e7d31dcfd4331c7b7b0f184bf376b

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I4633c71c515ab03a4e72ef08e1bb682dedc8c079
(cherry picked from commit 9c432d6db7de079aa4aed531e6f38836877bb365)

commit_message:
Release Neutron 9.1.0 (newton)

This change introduced a new configuration option
(ha_keepalived_state_change_server_threads) hence the minor version
bump.

Avoid tagging for vpnaas, fwaas and dynamic-routing
because those repositories did not get any updates since
previous release.

Change-Id: I0618cbde3d5390ae13b8a26204a1189592164a83

Ocata: Assessment for neutron-vpnaas

Change-Id: I1fea9e95393ec1ec3c4109759d2abb839373e1c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/82/383882/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Neutron-vpnaas Scorecard ======================== Neutron integration ------------------- .. _N0: * N0. As a non-starter, does the project use the Neutron REST API or relies on proprietary backends? .. _N1: * N1. Does the project integrate/use neutron-lib? .. _N2: * N2. Does project members actively contribute to help neutron-lib achieve its goal? .. _N3: * N3. Does project members collaborate with the core team to enable subprojects to loosely integrate with the Neutron core platform by helping with the definition of modular interfaces? .. _N4: * N4. How does the project provide networking services? Does it use modular interfaces as provided by the core platform? .. _N5: * N5. If the project provides new API extensions, have API extensions been discussed and accepted by the Neutron drivers team? Please provide links to API specs, if required. Documentation ------------- .. _D1: * D1. Does the project have a doc tox target, functional and continuously working? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org). .. _D2: * D2. If the project provide API extensions, does the project have an api-ref tox target, functional and continously working? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org). .. _D3: * D3. Does the project have a releasenotes tox target, functional and continously working? Provide proof. .. _D4: * D4. Describe the types of documentation available: developer, end user, administrator, deployer. Continuous Integration ---------------------- .. _C1: * C1. Does the project have a Grafana dashboard showing historical trends of all the jobs available? Provide proof (links to grafana.openstack.org). .. _C2: * C2. Does the project have CI for unit coverage? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org) .. _C3: * C3. Does the project have CI for functional coverage? If so, does it include DB migration and sync validation? .. _C4: * C4. Does the project have CI for fullstack coverage? .. _C5: * C5. Does the project have CI for Tempest coverage? If so, specify nature (API and/or Scenario). .. _C6: * C6. Does the project require CI for Grenade coverage? .. _C7: * C7. Does the project provide multinode CI? .. _C8: * C8. Does the project support Python 3.x? Provide proof. Release footprint ----------------- .. _R1: * R1. Does the project adopt semver? .. _R2: * R2. Does the project have release deliverables? Provide proof as available in the `release repo <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/>`_. Stable backports ---------------- .. _S1: * S1. Does the project have stable branches and/or tags? Provide history of backports. Client library -------------- .. _L1: * L1. If the project requires a client library, how does it implement CLI and API bindings? Scorecard --------- +---------------+ | Scorecard | +===============+ | N0_ | +|- | +---------------+ | N1_ | +|- | +---------------+ | N2_ | +|- | +---------------+ | N3_ | +|- | +---------------+ | N4_ | +|- | +---------------+ | N5_ | +|- | +---------------+ | D1_ | +|- | +---------------+ | D2_ | +|- | +---------------+ | D3_ | +|- | +---------------+ | D4_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C1_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C2_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C3_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C4_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C5_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C6_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C7_ | +|- | +---------------+ | C8_ | +|- | +---------------+ | R1_ | +|- | +---------------+ | R2_ | +|- | +---------------+ | S1_ | +|- | +-----+---------+ | L1_ | +|- | +-----+---------+ Final remarks: (To be compiled by PTL).

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I6784878e7a46560bebfb0be9d51b048da3774f70

subject: Add 'to_primitive' for MACAddress and IPNetwork
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 18:41:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/00910faea49411e084a0888d20d5842e60335936', 'message': "Add 'to_primitive' for MACAddress and IPNetwork

Both of these OVO common types did not have a to_primitive
method, so their native netaddr objects were being passed
to the json serializer.

For the MACAdddress object, this resulted in an traceback
because EUI types are not json encodable. For the IPNetwork,
this resulted in a list of every IP address in the network.

This fixes both by adding a 'to_primitive' method that calls
str on the netaddr objects, which results in sane representations
(string mac address and string CIDR).

This adds a base test the common types test case to ensure
all primitive representations are json serializable.

Change-Id: Ic0032e3fc12de643e6900702249e69d3946faa19
Closes-Bug: #1638664
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 20:57:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/common_types.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_common_types.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d400c04095e1e09468b3bd009ae7004b400fddea', 'message': "Add 'to_primitive' for MACAddress and IPNetwork
